courses.description:
Welcome,


Ansible is a radically simple IT automation system. It handles configuration management, application deployment, cloud provisioning, ad-hoc task execution, network automation, and multi-node orchestration. Ansible makes complex changes like zero-downtime rolling updates with load balancers easy.
Design Principles
Have an extremely simple setup process with a minimal learning curve.
Manage machines quickly and in parallel.
Avoid custom-agents and additional open ports, be agentless by leveraging the existing SSH daemon.
Describe infrastructure in a language that is both machine and human friendly.
Focus on security and easy auditability/review/rewriting of content.
Manage new remote machines instantly, without bootstrapping any software.
Allow module development in any dynamic language, not just Python.
Be usable as non-root.
Be the easiest IT automation system to use, ever.
OneDev is an open source all-in-one devops platform with the ability to manage git repositories, manage issues, and run continuous integrations.
The combination of these two tools gives you the ability to handle all the challenges you might face in your projects. We will start from the ground up. Build out our infracstructure, one machine where ansible and onedev will be configured. Then setup some clients and see all the possibilities that this combination provides. By the end of this course you will be proficient with both tools!
target_audience: Beginner DevOps engineers
Beginner System Administrators

Ter conhecimentos básicos sobre virtualização de servidores utilizando o VMware vSphere 7
Ter disponibilidade, motivação e dedicação para concluir o curso
courses.description:
Neste treinamento VMware 7, você tem o completo passo a passo de como configurar um cluster VMware vSphere 7 na sua casa utilizando as boas práticas de implementação de mercado.
São 15 tarefas dividas em 12 vídeo aulas, gerando ao final um treinamento super completo e prático.
Eu vou te mostrar em detalhes todos os passos para que você consiga criar seu próprio laboratório VMware 7 e começar a se tornar um expert em ti. Todo o processo que eu vou te mostrar adiante vai se basear em um framework muito simples, e mesmo que você nunca tenha configurado um laboratório dessa complexidade o guia irá te ajudar para que você consiga seguir todos os passos para o sucesso na criação do laboratório. Como todos vocês sabem, hoje o profissional de virtualização é bastante valorizado no mercado de trabalho. Então não perca tempo, vamos colocar a mão na massa e se tornar um expert em ti.


Aqui está tudo o que você precisa saber na hora de configurar um cluster VMware Vsphere 7. Além de configurar um cluster VMware 7 com 3 hosts ESXi 7,  este treinamento VMware 7 é baseado em um projeto real que vendo para meus clientes com bastante frequência.


Não pense que acabou!!! O melhor vem agora!
Vamos aprender com um passo a passo super detalhado, a como configurar um Storage iSCSI virtualizado de mercado. Isso mesmo, você irá aprender a configurar um Storage virtualizado de verdade e que é utilizado no mercado. Estamos falando do Storage virtual da HP, o StoreVirtual na última versão que é a 9.5/12.8. Depois que você concluir toda a configuração deste Storage Virtual, você terá conhecimento o suficiente para implementar qualquer Storage iSCSI de mercado e de qualquer fabricante. Além disso, nosso cluster VMware vSphere 7 será totalmente integrado a este Storage Virtual da HP.
Não perca tempo!!!
Este treinamento é composto de 10 tarefas práticas com inúmeras sub tarefas.
Segue abaixo as tarefas que serão ensinadas neste treinamento vmware 7.


AULA 1 - INTRODUÇÃO DO TREINAMENTE VMWARE VSPHERE 7


AULA 2 - INSTALAÇÃO DO VCENTER SERVER 7


AULA 3 - INSTALAÇÃO DO VMWARE VSPHERE 7


AULA 4 - CONFIGURAÇÕES INICIAIS DO HOSTS VMWARE E DA VM DE STORAGE iSCSI


AULA 5 - CONFIGURAÇÃO DO SOFTWARE DO STORAGE E INSTALAÇÃO DE UMA VM WINDOWS


AULA 6 - CONFIGURAÇÃO DO CLUSTER VMWARE NO VCENTER


AULA 8 - CONFIGURAÇÃO DO VDS - VIRTUAL DISTRIBUTED SWITCH


AULA 9 - APRESENTAR AS LUNs DO STORAGE HP PARA O CLUSTER VMWARE VSPHERE


AULA 10 - CONFIGURAÇÃO DE TEMPLATES - VMOTION - STORAGE VMOTION


AULA 11 - CONFIGURAÇÕES E TESTE DE DRS


AULA 12 - CONFIGURAÇÃO DO HA - FT - LIFE CYCLE MANAGER
target_audience: Administradores de sistema/rede que precisam saber implementar o VMware vSphere 7 de acordo com as boas práticas de mercado

courses.title: Proxmox VE 8.x - do Básico ao Avançado [v2025]
courses.bio: Domine essa ferramenta incrível e os seus recursos avançados para virtualização com alta disponibilidade!
objectives: Aqui estão alguns dados sobre o curso. Mas confira informações importantes na Descrição do Curso mais abaixo!
Entender conceitos sobre disponibilidade e como fazer para conseguir alta disponibilidade.
Implantar o Proxmox VE em modo standalone, em modo cluster com dois servidores e em modo de hiperconvergência com 3 (ou mais) servidores.
Gerenciar o Proxmox desde a instalação às configurações necessárias para mantê-lo operacional por longo prazo, com muitas dicas e boas práticas aplicadas.
Aprender a gerenciar as máquinas virtuais e criar ambientes com controle de acessos para usuários internos e externos.
Aprender técnicas avançadas para correção de erros e recuperação de desastres.
Implantar e utilizar uma VPN para acessar a estrutura de TI com segurança.

Módulo 03 - Implantação do PVE Standalon: Aviso sobre a Aula Firewall - Configuração da VPN
Firewall - Conectar à VPN com Linux/KDE/Windows/Mac
Aviso aos navegantes - Atualização do Firewall
Módulo 05 - Network no PVE: Isolando a rede de acesso ao PVE1
Módulo 07 - Gerenciamento de Cluster: Preparação para o Cluster - Cenário v2.0
PVE2 - Criação da VM e Instalação
Quorum, Cluster network e Remoção de nodes
Módulo 08 - Gerenciamento de VMs: VMs - Instalação do SO na VM
Módulo 10 - Hiper-convergência: Trabalhando com o Ceph - Parte 2: A Missão
Trabalhando com o Ceph - Parte 4: Falha em Disco
Trabalhando com o Ceph - Parte 5: Falha em Node

requirements: É interessante que você conheça o básico sobre sistemas operacionais, redes de computadores, Linux e Segurança da Informação para melhor aproveitamento, embora os conceitos sejam abordados de forma a conduzí-lo do básico ao avançado com tranquilidade.
Caso deseje executar os laboratórios do curso em sua plenitude, precisará de um computador com 8GB de memória e 120GB de espaço em disco livre, de preferência em SSD ou NVME e VirtualBox 7.0+.
courses.description:
Se você tem interesse em aprender sobre Virtualização, você está no lugar certo. Se além disso gostaria de aprender sobre o Proxmox, pode ter certeza de que é aqui mesmo.
Nesse curso vamos aprender sobre Virtualização utilizando uma ferramenta Open Source de alto nível, o Proxmox VE versão 8.x - PVE, focando na implementação de ambientes com hiperconvergência! Em breve teremos as aulas com a orientação para migrar para o PVE 9.x a partir da versão 8.x.
A proposta do curso é desenvolver as atividades em uma sequência, onde as ações realizadas em uma aula tem efeitos em aulas subsequentes. É dessa forma que o contexto do curso é montado e apresentado.
Virtualização é uma área cheia de detalhes e recursos que se conectam para trazer os melhores resultados. Nesse curso, busquei explorar muitas situações para que você tenha uma experiência bem próxima da realidade.
O Proxmox VE permite que você crie e gerencie o seu ambiente de uma forma incrível, sem complexas tarefas de gerenciamento de licenças e utilizando hardware comum, ou hardware avançado para setups de altíssimo desempenho.
Aqui você vai aprender sobre a Plataforma de Virtualização, o Gerenciamento da Rede no PVE, Áreas de Armazenamento, Gerenciamento de Clusters, Alta Disponibilidade, Hiper-convergência, Gestão de Acessos, Backup/Restore no PVE e Firewall do PVE.
Por falar em Firewall, para tornar a aplicação e o cenário mais abrangente, também vamos implantar um firewall simplificado que nos servirá para conectar todos os recursos que vamos utilizar e contextualizar uma forma de trabalhar a Virtualização em cenários reais, além de aprender sobre o Firewall do próprio PVE.
Esse curso cobre a maior parte dos conceitos e tópicos da Documentação Oficial, porém, de forma a abordar "como" realizar as tarefas e recheado de dicas e boas práticas que você pode aplicar para trabalhar melhor com seu ambiente.
Iremos além de apresentar conteúdo técnico, vamos seguir uma sequencia de atividades que proporcionarão a você aprender na prática e com contexto para fixar melhor o conteúdo.
target_audience: Este curso é essencial para quem busca conhecer melhor o universo da virtualização, seja profissional de TI, estudante ou entusiasta da área.

courses.title: Operating Systems Part 1: Concepts, Processes & Scheduling
courses.bio: Learn system structure, process management, threads, and CPU scheduling with simple explanations and examples.
objectives: Explain the basic functions and structure of an Operating System.
Describe the organization and architecture of computer systems and their interaction with the Operating System.
Understand the concept of processes, process states, operations on processes, and interprocess communication (IPC).
Explain multithreading and multicore programming concepts and evaluate different threading models.
Analyze and apply various CPU scheduling algorithms to improve process management.

Process Management: CPU switches from Process to Process
CPU Scheduling: Differences between Preemptive & Non Preemptive CPU Scheduling Algorithm

requirements: Basic Knowledge of Computer Fundamentals like basic any language Programming skills
Basic Understanding of Data Structures
Logical Thinking and Problem Solving
courses.description:
Course Description
Welcome to Operating Systems Part 1!
Are you a student, software enthusiast, or developer eager to understand what really happens "behind the scenes" when your computer runs? This course is your perfect starting point.
In this beginner-to-intermediate level course, we break down the core concepts of Operating Systems (OS) in a way that's simple, practical, and exam-oriented. Whether you’re preparing for university exams, technical interviews, or just curious about how modern OSes work — this course is for you!
What You'll Learn
By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Understand what an Operating System does and how it interacts with hardware and users.
Describe the structure and functions of modern operating systems.
Explore the process lifecycle, operations, and interprocess communication (IPC).
Learn how threads improve performance and how multithreading works on multicore systems.
Analyze and implement key CPU scheduling algorithms like FCFS, SJF, Priority Scheduling, and Round Robin.
Course Topics Covered
This course focuses on Unit-1 and Unit-2 level content, typically taught in academic Operating Systems syllabi:
Introduction to Operating Systems
Computer System Architecture & OS Structures
Operating System Services & Interfaces
System Calls & Types of System Calls
Process Concepts & Lifecycle
Interprocess Communication (IPC)
Threads & Multithreading Models
CPU Scheduling – Criteria & Algorithms (FCFS, SJF, Priority, RR)
Who Should Take This Course?
Undergraduate Students
Postgraduate Students
Aspiring Software Developers / Engineers
Teaching Assistants / Lecturers
Competitive Exam Aspirants
Working Professionals in IT
Self-Learners and Enthusiasts
Prerequisites
Basic knowledge of computer fundamentals.
Familiarity with programming logic (C or pseudocode is an Additional content,).
Curiosity and willingness to learn!
Let’s Get Started!
Join now and gain a strong foundation in Operating Systems — the core of computer science. Start with Part 1 and build your way up with confidence!
target_audience: Undergraduate & Postgraduate Students
Aspiring Software Developers / Engineers
Teaching Assistants / Lecturers
Competitive Exam Aspirants
Working Professionals in IT
Self-Learners and Enthusiasts

requirements: Conocimientos Básicos de Hardware y Software
courses.description:
¿Te imaginas poder rescatar la información más importante que guarda un disco duro o cualquier otro medio de almacenamiento? Con este curso, aprenderás a solucionar fallas de hardware y software que incluso los técnicos experimentados a veces no saben resolver y evitarás que personas y empresas pierdan lo que realmente les importa.
¿Por qué este curso es para ti?
Recupera la Información Valiosa: No dejes que virus o errores del sistema te hagan perder fotos, documentos y archivos importantes. Aprenderás a recuperar información de discos duros, pendrives, memorias de cámaras y hasta celulares.
Diferénciate del Resto: Olvídate de ser un técnico que solo formatea computadoras e instala programas. Con los conocimientos que adquieras, serás capaz de solucionar problemas de verdad y ofrecer un servicio de alta calidad.
Demanda en el Mercado: Empresas y particulares necesitan respaldos y soluciones para recuperar datos valiosos. Con este curso, tendrás una gran oportunidad para destacar y aumentar tus ingresos.
¿Qué aprenderás?
Mantenimiento Preventivo: Descubre cómo cuidar tanto discos duros de estado sólido como mecánicos para reducir fallas.
Solución de Problemas: Aprende a reparar fallas lógicas y físicas, aplicar formateos de bajo nivel y clonar discos duros cuando sea necesario.
Recuperación Efectiva de Datos: Domina las técnicas para recuperar particiones, archivos eliminados y hasta contraseñas en los principales sistemas operativos (Windows 7, 8, 10 y 11).
Herramientas y Buenas Prácticas: Conocerás las herramientas imprescindibles del mercado, crearás pendrives multi-boot, y aprenderás a realizar copias de seguridad eficientes.
Soporte Técnico Remoto: Además, verás cómo ofrecer soporte técnico a distancia, lo que te permitirá ampliar tu clientela y brindar soluciones de manera ágil.
Contenido del Curso:
Cuidados y mantenimiento de discos duros (SSD y mecánicos).
Cómo crear y gestionar particiones.
Reparación de fallas lógicas y físicas.
Técnicas de formateo de bajo nivel.
Clonación de discos duros.
Recuperación de particiones y archivos eliminados.
Recuperación de contraseñas en diferentes versiones de Windows.
Creación de pendrives multi-boot.
Herramientas esenciales para técnicos.
Estrategias para copias de seguridad en Windows, particiones y archivos.
Soporte técnico remoto.
Y mucho más…
¿A quién va dirigido?
Si eres técnico o usuario con nociones básicas y quieres dar el salto a un nivel avanzado, este curso es para ti. Aprenderás de forma actualizada, sin perder tiempo en temas que ya no se aplican, y estarás listo para resolver cualquier problema que se te presente.
¡No dejes pasar esta oportunidad para ampliar tus habilidades y convertirte en el técnico de confianza en recuperación de datos!
¿Listo para transformar tu carrera y ayudar a otros a recuperar lo que consideran invaluable?
¡Te esperamos en el curso!
target_audience: Estudiantes de primaria, secundaria y universitaria.
Técnicos en informática que desean actualizar sus conocimientos y habilidades.
Profesionales en el área de tecnología.
Personas que desean aprender una profesión y trabajar de forma independiente.

courses.title: Linux - free operating system for your computer
courses.bio: Linux is an open-source operating system that powers everything from smartphones and servers to personal computers
requirements: There is no requirements or prerequisites for taking this course, anyone can take it, even just out of couriosity. Just take some time for it and you will have fun while learning something new.
courses.description:
In our Linux course, we'll explore what Linux is, its history and evolution, and the concept of open source along with its benefits. We will show main Linux flavors (distributions) with emphasize on Ubuntu.
Linux is an open-source operating system (OS) that powers everything from smartphones and servers to personal computers and supercomputers. It is known for its stability, security, and flexibility. Unlike proprietary operating systems like Windows or macOS, Linux is free to use, modify, and distribute.
It is especially good for use on older hardware (computers 5 years old or older) and our main goal in creating this course was to let you know there is alternative for your old PCs and they can get new life with Linux. Linux can work on hardware that is not strong and you still get all the tools you need and have operating system that is up-to-date and safe to use.
In this short course you will get familiar with basic concepts of Linux and this course is excellent for you to gain some general knowledge and to see if Linux is good choice for your personal or business computing needs.
Course is in easy and slow narrative and it is particularly suitable for people who’s 1st language in not English because we use general and easy vocabulary.
target_audience: This course is for anyone who wish to learn something more about world of personal computers.
This course is for students who wish to get familiar with Linux operating system, especially with Ubuntu.
This course is for people who are looking for free alternatives to MS Windows or MacOS.
This course is for people who wish to use their old computers in new ways.

objectives: Eğitim içeriği uygulamalıdır. Eğitim bilgiyi sizlere en hızlı ve doğru şekilde aktarmak üzerine tasarlanmıştır.
Kali Linux Terminal Komutları
Dosya İşlemleri
Kullanıcı Oluşturma ve Silme
Yetkilendirme İşlemleri
Port Bağlantı Durumları Tespiti
Linux Firewall Ayarları -İptables
Etik Hacker Eğitimi Öncesi Hızlandırılmış Kali Linux Eğitimi
requirements: Temel Bilgisayar Bilgisi
Kali Linux ve Virtual Box Kurulumu
courses.description:
Eğitim içeriği yeni başlayan birisi için tasarlanmıştır.  Kurulum işlemlerinin ardından yapılması gereken tanımlamalar ve ardından en önemli terminal komutları ile girizgah yapılmıştır. Eğitimin devamında linux üzerinden kullanılabilir komutlar ve dizin hiyerarşisi üzerinde durulmuştur. Kullanıcı oluşturma, yetki işlemleri ile devam eden eğitim içeriği kendi içerisinde network komutları, sistem bilgisi öğrenme komutları ve linux üzerinden firewall yapılandırma ile devam etmektedir.


Kali Linux, içerisinde 600’den fazla sızma testi aracı bulunduran ve etik hackerlık ile güvenlik denetimleri uygulamalarının tek bir sistem üzerinden gerçekleştirilmesini amaçlayan bir işletim sistemidir. Kali Linux, Offensive Security tarafından Linux işletim sisteminin bir dağıtımı olan Debian’ın standartlarına göre geliştirilmiş, ücretsiz ve birçok dil seçeneğine sahip açık kaynaklı bir işletim sistemidir.
Etik hackerlık ve sızma testi uygulamalarından, adli bilişim ve tersine mühendisliğe kadar birçok konuda çok sayıda araç barındırdığından dolayı Kali Linux siber güvenlik alanında sıkça tercih edilen bir işletim sistemidir.


Kali Linux’u kullanırken bazı durumlarda çeşitli sorunla karşılaşmanız mümkündür. Fakat etik hackerlık ve sızma testi alanında kendinizi geliştirmek istiyorsanız bu sorunlarla karşılaşmanız ve çözmeye çalışmanız oldukça önemlidir.


Kurulum işlemlerinin ardından yapılması gereken tanımlamalar ve ardından en önemli terminal komutları ile girizgah yapılmıştır. Eğitimin devamında linux üzerinden kullanılabilir komutlar ve dizin hiyerarşisi üzerinde durulmuştur. Kullanıcı oluşturma, yetki işlemleri ile devam eden eğitim içeriği kendi içerisinde network komutları, sistem bilgisi öğrenme komutları ve linux üzerinden firewall yapılandırma ile devam etmektedir.
target_audience: Kali linux öğrenmek isteyen

São 23 aulas práticas do sistema SAP com as principais transações do SAP para ajudar você a se sair bem na sua empresa.


São 2 módulos em 1 Curso, com suporte ao aluno todos os dias da semana!


O que é o sistema SAP ?
O SAP é um sistema mundial, utilizado em cerca de 190 paises do mundo, e no Brasil cerca de 70% das grandes empresas utilizam o SAP.
O Sap é dividido por módulos, que atendem todas as áreas de um negócio de uma empresa.
O sistema SAP hoje é utilizado em mais de 190 paises, por mais de 200 mil empresas, e geralmente as empresas que utilizam o SAP são empresas multinacionais ou empresas de grande porte, que emitem uma grande quantidade de notas fiscais todos os dias.
Um profissional com conhecimento e experiência no sistema SAP pode atuar em diversas áreas e funções. Dentre elas a mais conhecida é a profissão de Consultor SAP, que possui várias vertentes, mas existem diversos cargos que exigem conhecimento no sistema SAP.
Ter o dominio no sistema SAP abre as portas para trabalhar em qualquer grande empresa do mercado nacional ou internacional.

Profissionais com Inglês e conhecimentos no SAP, conseguem com mais facilidade trabalhar em diversas áreas e cargos, que ganham em média R$ 4.000,00 á R$ 29.000,00 no Brasil, já na Europa, Estados Unidos e Canada este valor pode chegar a 5 x mais.

O SAP pode ser usado por diversos profissionais e áreas de uma grande empresa, vou dar alguns exemplos de cargos que utilizam o SAP;

Além de Industrias, Comercios atacadistas e varejistas, também existem diversas empresas de Consultoria que prestam serviços de implantação e suporte ao sistema SAP.

Geralmente quem trabalha com SAP, pode trabalhar direto para uma empresa, com carteira assinada, e ter muitos beneficios dependendo da empresa, ou você pode trabalhar como Pessoa Juridica para empresas de Consultoria SAP ou sistemas complementares ao SAP, como é o caso do sistema Mastersaf Dw, Syncro, Guepardo, Solutio, entre outros sistemas existentes no mercado.

courses.title: Legacy IT - Technical Support & Desktop Troubleshooting Tips
courses.bio: Learn how to troubleshoot device compatibility issues on older operating systems & hardware, i.e. Windows 95/98

IT Support Tips: Introduction: Making the most of this course

requirements: To be an IT Professional with around 1-2 years experience
courses.description:
Over this course, we'll be covering legacy operating systems and the things you need to know when troubleshooting any issues. Course topics include the following:


* Hardware ports that you would find on older machines, such as PS/2, USB, Parallel, Serial & SCSI ports.
* Legacy file systems such as FAT16 and FAT32.
* Legacy boot configuration files and how they work
* Plug and play support for hardware devices
* Security considerations and compatibility mode
* System activation and built-in applications
* An overview of machine virtualisation and dual-booting between different operating systems.


Also included in this course are some real-world examples of where you might find older machines, and what the best procedure is within most organisations when planning any changes, whether this is due to an emergency, or due to a planned upgrade or decommissioning of old equipment during a major project.
Note that wherever possible, legacy hardware should no longer be in use on a production network, however this course is designed to help you deal with those situations where this simply isn't possible, for example if the cost of replacing equipment is too great, or if there is any other reason this needs to remain operational, such as legal or compliance reasons specific to an organisation.
target_audience: IT Professionals wanting to learn more about legacy operating systems

courses.bio: Install, secure and host with WHM/cPanel

Welcome: Deploy Linux Server , update and add hostname to Cloudflare
Need support? Get help setting up Linux server or Control panel

requirements: You will need internet connectivity to get started.
A little familiarity with Linux is encouraged.
Access to a computer to enable SSH access to your cloud server
courses.description:
This WHM cPanel turoial will show you how to use WHM and Cpanel. You will start by deploying and setting up Linux server. And move on to installing WHM/cpanel. Eventually you will get to adding a website on your WHM server.


Let’s dive into WHM (Web Host Manager) and cPanel! If you’re looking to get a handle on managing web hosting, WHM and cPanel are two essential tools you'll want to get familiar with.
WHM (Web Host Manager): Think of WHM as the admin control panel for hosting providers. It gives you the power to manage multiple cPanel accounts, which is crucial if you're running a hosting business or managing a large number of sites. With WHM, you can create and manage cPanel accounts, set up hosting packages, and configure server settings.
Here’s a basic rundown on what you can do with WHM:
Create and Manage cPanel Accounts: You can easily set up new accounts for your clients or users, adjust their permissions, and view their usage statistics.
Set Up Hosting Packages: Define the features and resources available to your users by creating different hosting packages, like storage limits, bandwidth, and email accounts.
Server Configuration: WHM lets you configure server-wide settings, such as security options, DNS settings, and Apache configurations.
cPanel: This is the control panel that your users will interact with. It’s designed to be user-friendly and gives them access to manage their individual websites. In cPanel, users can handle things like:
File Management: Upload, download, and organize files directly through the File Manager.
Email Accounts: Set up and manage email addresses, including creating new accounts and filtering spam.
Databases: Manage databases using tools like phpMyAdmin.
Domains: Add and manage domains and subdomains.
Backup and Restore: Create backups of their website and restore them if needed.
target_audience: Anyone who would like to learn how to use WHM/cPanel

courses.bio: Learn basics of docker

Introduction to Docker: Installation & Running Hello World using Docker

Docker Container Lifecycles: How to create, start, stop container
Custom Image in Docker: Dockerfile NGINX container with HTML website
Dockerfile with a Hello World project of Nodejs

requirements: Basics of IT & using operating system
courses.description:
Docker is very important tool in DevOps. It is now also mostly used by programmers for development of their tech stack for web development project. In this series we will cover basics of docker
- Installation & running hello world
- What are images, how to get them from dockerhub
- How to create, start, stop container
- Dockerfile nginx container with HTML website
- Docker file with a hello world project of Nodejs


Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels. Because all of the containers share the services of a single operating system kernel, they use fewer resources than virtual machines.


Docker can package an application and its dependencies in a virtual container that can run on any Linux, Windows, or macOS computer. This enables the application to run in a variety of locations, such as on-premises, in public (see decentralized computing, distributed computing, and cloud computing) or private cloud. When running on Linux, Docker uses the resource isolation features of the Linux kernel (such as cgroups and kernel namespaces) and a union-capable file system (such as OverlayFS) to allow containers to run within a single Linux instance, avoiding the overhead of starting and maintaining virtual machines. Docker on macOS uses a Linux virtual machine to run the containers.
target_audience: Anybody who just want to know basics of docker

courses.title: Hands-On Introduction to Orchestration with Kubernetes
courses.bio: A practical beginner’s guide to Kubernetes orchestration, pods, deployments, services, scaling, and more.

Setup: VS Code and Extensions for Kubernetes

requirements: Basic understanding of Docker
Basic terminal/command-line experience
courses.description:
Welcome to Hands-On Introduction to Orchestration with Kubernetes. I'm Lucas, a tech lead working in an international team, and I’ve created this course to make Kubernetes understandable and practical - especially if you’re stepping into DevOps, backend development, or modern cloud infrastructure.
If you've already worked with Docker and wondered what comes next - how containers are managed at scale, how apps stay running, or how teams handle deployments and rollouts - this course is for you.
We'll start from the ground up by setting up our local Kubernetes cluster using Minikube, then we'll walk through core concepts step by step. You'll get hands-on with pods, deployments, services, ConfigMaps, Secrets, and persistent storage — all with quick examples.
What you can learn in this course:
What Kubernetes is and how it works
How to deploy and scale applications
How to expose your apps to the outside world
How to manage configurations, secrets, and storage
How to work with kubectl, YAML files, and namespaces
This course is fast, focused, and beginner-friendly - with no slides and unnecessary theory, everything is hands-on.
By the end, you'll understand how Kubernetes works and be confident using it in your projects or on the job.
Let’s demystify Kubernetes and get hands-on together!
target_audience: Developers and DevOps beginners who want to understand Kubernetes
Anyone curious about how container orchestration works
Engineers working with Docker looking for the next step
Students preparing for a cloud-native role or certification

objectives: How to create a Linux virtualization host with enterprise Linux (Rocky or Alma).

requirements: Basic Linux knowledge. Students should feel comfortable on the bash command line and know a number of basic commands.
Students need a computer system, e.g. a NUC, on which Linux and the virtualization layer is installed.
Willingness to learn. Many topics are touched but not covered in detail. Hence many references are given.
Willingness to read. The course includes a course guide with step by step instructions and many appendices.
courses.description:
In this course the student constructs a Linux virtualization host with standard technologies like KVM, qemu and libvirt. By creating Linux base images and using the provisioning tool Terraform the student learns how to quickly instantiate VMs. To ease access to the VMs, the student is introduced to Ansible for configuration management.
The course material provides step by step instructions and some example sets of VMs, which we call "labenvs". Special care has been taken to make the course material usable as an instructions guide and as reference material. In the appendices extra information is provided about different topics and the references section guides the student to many sources on the Internet.
Almost all of the commands are easily pasteable into a terminal. This makes getting things done on the terminal fast and avoids the risk of this course becoming a typing exercise.
After introducing the different technologies, we together make a labenv tool in Python to make the management of the "labenvs" easy and efficient. This wrapper tool makes setting up Terraform and Ansible for "labenvs" literally a task of a second.
The goal of the course is to enable students to setup "labenvs" for experimentation with software products. In the process all steps are explained in such a way that the student can tinker with the setup to play, understand and possibly extend the labenv tool.
To demonstrate the value of labenv, we setup an Apache reverse proxy lab environment that we use to discuss some of the intricasies of Apache as a reverse proxy.
target_audience: This course is aimed at Linux enthousiasts or Linux engineers who want to setup their own laboratory environment in which they can easily test software and technologies. By creating a "labenv" tool together an environment is setup that can be tinkered with and provides an easy and efficient way to setup sets of VMs (labenvs).

courses.bio: A Beginner's Guide to Using the Linux Command Line Effectively

The Linux Command Line: Cat, Head, Less, More, and Tail

requirements: No experience with Linux required, just an interest in learning the basics.
courses.description:
Are you interested in starting a career in Information Technology, Cyber Security, or Systems Administration? If so, learning Linux is an essential step. Linux is one of the most highly sought-after skills by employers and there is an immediate need for people who have these skills in these career fields.
In our basic Linux command line course, you'll learn how to access and perform simple tasks in the command line, providing you with a solid foundation to build upon in the future. You don't need any prior experience with Linux to take this course - we'll start with the basics and gradually introduce more advanced concepts.
By gaining exposure and experience with the Ubuntu Linux command line, you'll be giving yourself a competitive advantage in the job market. You'll learn how to navigate the file system, manage files and directories, manipulate text files, and manage processes. You'll also gain practical experience using command line tools for networking, system administration, and troubleshooting.
Not only will this course give you valuable hands-on experience with Linux, it will also help you prepare for industry-recognized certifications such as CompTIA Linux+, LPI Linux Essentials, and RedHat Certifications.
Whether you're just starting out in IT or looking to freshen up your skills, this course will help you gain valuable experience that can set you apart from other candidates. You'll also be setting the foundation for acquiring other skills, such as setting up ideal developer environments or pivoting into learning how to become an ethical hacker or cybersecurity analyst.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to gain valuable skills and experience that can help you succeed in a rewarding career in Information Technology, Cyber Security, or Systems Administration.
Sign up for our basic Linux command line course now and take the first step towards a successful career in this exciting and in-demand field!
target_audience: IT professionals who want to develop a strong foundational understanding of the Linux operating system and command line interface.
Developers who work with Linux servers and need to manage files, directories, and processes using command line tools.
System administrators who want to automate repetitive tasks and perform administrative tasks using command line utilities.

courses.description:
This primary aim of this short course is to help MAC users install and test a virtual Ubuntu Linux server on VirtualBox, in around an hour.  Although becoming an expert in Linux will take some years, it is not difficult to get a basic server up and running and to get a taste of Linux in an hour.
Linux is very widely used now in Internet infrastructure like Web servers, in Public Cloud infrastructure like Amazon AWS and in Private Clouds running on OpenStack.  So it will be really worth your while to get some basic experience on the Linux OS before you start working on Cloud servers.
The two great things about running a VM on your MAC are (i) if it goes wrong, you can easily delete it and start again and (ii) you can work offline without an Internet connection. I hope you benefit from the value of this short course.  I really enjoyed putting it together for you.

Nowadays working with different os is need of the technology so understanding and learning of different os is very important. If you know different commands then it is very easy to learn Linux system. Linux is a Unix, open source and community developed operating system (OS) for computers, servers, mainframes, mobile devices, robots and embedded devices. It is supported on almost every major different computer platform, including x86, ARM and SPARC, making it one of the most widely supported operating systems. Linux is used extensively on servers in businesses, and has been for a long time. Linux is also used in some corporate environments as the desktop platform for their employees, with commercially available solutions including Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop, and Ubuntu. The Google gLinux team builds the system from source code, introducing their own changes. gLinux replaced the previously used Ubuntu-based distribution, Goobuntu.

courses.description:
This course is intended for beginners only. I'll be using Ubuntu Operating system, one of the most popular Linux Distributions,  to help you learn how to navigate Linux operating systems.


* To begin with.  first and foremost we'll learn how to install Ubuntu Operating System on a Virtual Machine.
* Then we'll learn how to navigate it  using the Graphical User Interface (by pressing the icons on the monitor)
* We'll also learn what a directory is and what a  Linux file system is, how it is structured and how to navigate it.
* Then we will learn basic terminal commands to navigate Ubuntu Operating System from the Terminal
* We'll also be learning about Directory loops, Inode, and different types of links on Ubuntu Terminal.


What is Linux?


Linux is an open source operating system. But hold on a second, what is an Operating system? As the name states, Operating System is the core software required to operate a computer, an operating system is responsible for communicating with the hardware & allocate it’s resources for you to execute commands & run programs. It acts as an interface and Without it, you wont be able to use a computer.
There are many types of Computer Operating systems, The most notable ones are Windows & Mac OS, but unlike them Linux is Open source. It means, Linux is freely accessible & modifiable, making it very popular. From smartphones to cars, supercomputers and home appliances, home desktops to enterprise servers, the Linux operating system is everywhere. From cheap android phones to super computers on Wall street, they’re powered by Linux Operating System.
There are different types of Linux Distributions, such as Arch Linux, Debian OS & Fedora. In this video I’ll be using Ubuntu Operating system.


No prior IT knowledge required to begin this course. This is my first course on Udemy and I'd appreciate your feed back to improve the quality of the content produced. I wish you best of luck and Happy Learning.
target_audience: Beginners
Those who are interested in learning more about Linux

courses.title: Semantic search with vector databases
courses.bio: From theory to practical implementation with Pinecone and AI
objectives: Understand the fundamentals of semantic search and vector databases
Create and manage vector indexes with Pinecone
Implement text processing pipelines for vector databases
Develop advanced queries and AI assistants for vector search

Module 1: Introduction to Semantic Search and Vector Databases

Module 5: Introduction to Queries in Vector Databases

requirements: Basic programming skills (preferably in Python).
Introductory knowledge of APIs and HTTP requests.
Computer with internet access to test the codes in practice.
Free Pinecone account.
No previous experience with vector databases or semantic search is required.
courses.description:
Semantic search and vector databases are transforming the way we deal with large volumes of information, making searches more precise and contextualized. If you want to understand this innovative technology and apply it to your projects, this course is for you.


In this course, you will learn everything from the fundamental concepts of semantic search to the practical implementation of vector databases using Pinecone, one of the leading platforms for vector storage and retrieval. We will explore how to transform text into vectors, create efficient indexes and build intelligent queries to find relevant information quickly.


What will you learn?
Fundamentals of Semantic Search and Vector Databases – Understand how vectors represent meaning and context in searches.
Creating and Managing Vector Indexes – Configure and manipulate vector databases using Pinecone.
Text Processing for Embeddings – Extract data from documents, strategically split text, and generate high-quality embeddings.
Building Advanced Query – Learn how to retrieve information efficiently and accurately.
Developing an AI Assistant – Create a system that answers questions based on vector search.


Who is this course for?


This course is ideal for developers, data scientists, AI professionals, and students who want to deepen their knowledge of semantic search and vector databases. Whether you want to build recommendation systems, search engines, or intelligent chatbots, this course will provide you with the knowledge you need.


No prior experience with vector databases is required.
target_audience: Developers and data scientists who want to learn about semantic search and vector databases.
AI and Machine Learning professionals interested in optimizing information retrieval using embeddings.
Students and researchers working in natural language processing (NLP) who need to store and query large volumes of data efficiently.
Entrepreneurs and technology enthusiasts who want to build intelligent assistants, chatbots, and personalized search engines.

courses.description:
Empezaremos este curso recorriendo todas las opciones de arranque y recuperación con que cuenta Windows 10, veremos la configuración de inicio, las herramientas de arranque como BCDEdit y BCDBoot, la creación de unidades de recuperación, conoceremos Windows Preinstallation Environment o WinPE, los principales problemas de inicio del sistema, y como hacer arranques duales.
Después nos centraremos en las herramientas administrativas de Windows, la mayoría de estas basadas en la Microsoft Management Console o Consola de administración de Microsoft, el programador de tareas, el administrador de dispositivos, la administración de discos, y las variables de entorno del sistema.
También le echamos un vistazo al Registro de Windows, conoceremos su estructura, y veremos cómo realizar acciones en él, como: restringir el acceso, hacer copias de seguridad, modificar el registro, y trabajar con archivos REG desde Visual Studio Code para modificar el registro.
Windows también tiene comandos para la terminal que sirven para diagnosticar, informar, y hacer pruebas en nuestra red. Veremos estos comandos y cómo podemos usarlos.
Finalmente echaremos un vistazo al Windows Subsystem for Linux o WSL, que nos permite mediante una máquina virtual especial gestionar distros GNU/Linux directamente desde Windows, pudiendo usar ambos sistemas operativos de manera simultánea y con una excelente interoperatividad. Vamos a verlo desde la instalación, como usar el comando wsl, la configuración de WSL, lo básico de Windows Terminal, como interoperar entre Windows y Gnu-Linux, y Al final haremos una práctica donde corremos un servidor en Linux y podemos trabajar con él desde Windows.
Este curso es de un nivel avanzado, por lo que daré por hecho que sabes usar Windows a nivel de usuario final y me centraré únicamente en las explicaciones que tengan que ver con el tema, aunque algunas veces hare una única explicación sobre algunas acciones para que no sientas que el curso es repetitivo. Si vienes de mi Curso Completo de Windows, notarás que ya no me detendré a explicar cosas básicas, y que tampoco iré tan lento conforme avanzan los temas. Si no has tomado ningún curso mío anteriormente, sólo asegúrate de que conoces los temas anteriores para que no tengas inconvenientes durante tu proceso formativo.
Este curso es perfectamente compatible con Windows 11. Así que no debe preocuparte el actualizar al nuevo sistema operativo de Microsoft.

courses.description:
¿Alguna vez te has preguntado cómo las empresas de tecnología gestionan aplicaciones complejas y escalables? El mundo del desarrollo moderno se basa en la cultura DevOps y la arquitectura de Microservicios. Este curso te llevará a dominar no solo la teoría, sino también a comprender la implementación práctica de estas poderosas filosofías.
Partiremos de un proyecto real, un sistema de Pasaporte Covid 19, para enseñarte el proceso completo: desde el análisis de requerimientos hasta el diseño de una arquitectura de microservicios con DDD, la implementación con Docker y el despliegue de las soluciones. Al final, serás capaz de construir proyectos robustos y eficientes.
Lo que aprenderás
Comprenderás los fundamentos teóricos de DevOps, Microservicios y APIs y su importancia en la industria.
Dominarás conceptos de arquitectura como DDD (Design Driven Domain) y patrones de diseño como Event-Driven y Saga.
Aprenderás a analizar y a diseñar soluciones con microservicios, justificando las decisiones de diseño como Monorepos vs. Microrepos.
Profundizarás en conceptos de Git (GitFlow, TrunkBased) y flujos de CI/CD para integrar procesos, personas y tecnologías.
Entenderás los principales estilos de despliegue (Canary, Blue-Green, Rolling Update) y cuándo aplicar cada uno.
Aprenderás a gestionar información sensible con secrets y a implementar seguridad con protocolos como OAuth2 y JWT.
Conceptualizarás las APIs: Aprenderás sobre los diferentes tipos de APIs y los enfoques de diseño (API First, Code First).
Seguridad y Confianza: Entenderás el propósito de una infraestructura de clave pública y cómo se utiliza para la seguridad de las APIs.
Explorarás cómo la AI y herramientas como swagger editor y diagramas .net se utilizan para automatizar y agilizar el diseño.
Simulaciones con IA: Practica y prepárate para futuras entrevistas y reuniones.
En el mundo real, la teoría no basta. Por eso, este curso incluye un componente único: "Role Plays" con Inteligencia Artificial. Prepárate para dos escenarios cruciales que validarán tu conocimiento y te darán confianza:
Prepárate para la entrevista técnica: Enfréntate a una IA que actúa como reclutador para dominar tus fundamentos y conceptos clave.
Defiende tu estrategia ante un CTO: Practica cómo convencer a un líder técnico sobre una propuesta de arquitectura para la compañía, demostrando una visión estratégica.
¿A quién está dirigido?
Este curso es ideal para cualquier persona que quiera comprender y aplicar una implementación exitosa de DevOps o Microservicios, incluyendo:
Desarrolladores que buscan una comprensión más profunda de la arquitectura y el despliegue.
Emprendedores, CTOs y Gerentes de Proyecto que necesitan optimizar la productividad y reducir costos en sus equipos de desarrollo.
Estudiantes y profesionales de IT que desean especializarse y crecer en el mundo de la tecnología.
Cualquiera que quiera pasar de los comandos y conceptos básicos a un pensamiento estratégico y profesional.
target_audience: Personas que esten interesadas en dar sus primeros pasos en DevOps o que tienen algunas nociones en DevOps pero no comprenden el contexto completo de DevOps.
Estudiantes de carreras afines a la tecnología, como gestion de proyectos, ingenieria de sistemas o carreras similares
Personas con formacion administrativa que se dediquen a la gestion de proyectos.
Ingenieros de sistemas o desarrolladores que desen dar un paso adelante y avanzar en sus carreras
Administradores de sistemas que quieran incursionar en unos de los campos mejores pagos del mercado y con mayor demanda

courses.description:
Welcome to Hands-On Introduction to Linux with Ubuntu. I'm Lucas, a tech lead working in an international team, and I’ve created this course to make Linux simple and approachable — especially if you're just starting out in tech or exploring DevOps, backend development, or cloud computing.
In this course, we’ll go hands-on with Ubuntu, one of the most popular Linux distributions. We’ll start by setting it up together and walking through the system step by step — no prior experience required.
You’ll learn:
How to navigate the file system using the terminal
How to create, move, and delete files and folders
How permissions and users work in Linux
How to monitor your system and manage running processes
How to find files and search through text with powerful tools like grep, find, and xargs
How to automate tasks with cron
How to write your first bash script
How to use essential tools like curl, tar, ssh, and more
By the end of this course, you’ll not only understand how Linux works — you’ll be comfortable using it for everyday tasks, development, or server management.
If you're curious about Linux, thinking about a tech career, or just want to expand your skills — you're in the right place.
Let’s make Linux practical, empowering, and fun!

courses.description:
INTRODUCCIÓN
=============
Durante este curso vas a aprender a gestionar y trabajar con el entorno de virtualización de Vmware,  que es el más utilizado para trabajar en entornos empresariales y profesionales
Comenzaremos desde CERO, con conceptos básicos de virtualización y luego avanzaremos de forma que lleguemos a conceptos avanzados.
Mis cursos son MUY PRÁCTICOS, todo lo que vemos en la teoría lo aplicamos mediante laboratorios y ejemplos
Por tanto, si a nivel profesional o personal, quieres mejorar tu experiencia y aprender a utilizar uno de los trabajos más demandados, este es tu curso.
Este curso te puede ayudar a preparar la certificación VCP-DCV 2022, aunque por supuesto no debería ser tu única fuente de preparación. Mis cursos están muy orientados a aprender a manejar el producto y no solo a aprender un montçon de conceptos teóricos


¿QUÉ VEREMOS DURANTE LA FORMACIÓN?
==================================
Durante el  curso aprenderemos todos los conceptos necesarios para poder trabajar de forma real con Vmware y sus productos ESXi y vCenter.
Entre los puntos que abordaremos:
Introducción a los conceptos de virtualización
Instalación y configuración de ESXi y de vCenter
Trabajar con máquinas virtuales
Trabajar con redes y almacenamiento virtualizados
Crear y trabajar con clusters
Gestionar la alta disponibilidad y otros conceptos como Failover, Fault Tolerance, etc..
Migrar máquinas virtuales con vMotion
Veremos conceptos  de seguridad, licencias, etc...
Realizar Backups y Restores de vCenter
Y muchas más cosas!!!!


¿NECESITO MUCHA INFRAESTRUCTURA PARA HACER EL CURSO?
===================================================
ESXi y vCenter son productos profesionales y que están orientados a infraestructuras complejas en las empresas.
Por lo tanto, vas a necesitar disponer de  una serie de recursos que son más altos que para un curso normal.
Para la primera parte del curso (ESXi) necesitaremos:
- PC con al menos 16 Gigas de RAM (que será mayor si quieres arrancar muchas máquinas virtuales)
- 4 CPUs
- El PC debe tener activa la opción de virtualización en la BIOS
- 400 GB de disco


Para la segunda parte del curso  (vCenter) necesitamos más recursos
- PC con 32Gigas de RAM
- 4 Cpus
- El PC debe tener activa la opción de virtualización en la BIOS
- 600 Gigas de Disco
- Tener otro PC para la parte del almacenamiento externo (NFS-iSCSI) con 12 gigas de RAM


Dispones de muchos vídeos que puedes pre-visualizar para ver la calidad del curso.


Si tienes cualquier pregunta, no dudes en ponerte en contacto conmigo


Saludos
Apasoft Training
target_audience: Personas y profesionales que necesiten trabaja con un entorno virtualizado con Vmware
Cualquier persona que quiera ampliar sus conocimientos en Vmware y mejorar su curriculum

Dive into "Linux Mastery for Modern Developers and DevOps" and transform your Linux skills with a comprehensive training experience! This course is designed to elevate your expertise, whether you’re a developer or a DevOps professional. You'll start by mastering the Linux command line and understanding the fundamental components of the Linux operating system. As you progress, you'll delve into shell scripting, learning to automate tasks and streamline workflows with powerful scripts. You’ll explore advanced text processing tools, manage files and permissions, and handle compressed files and archives with ease. The course also covers essential package management using `apt` and `yum`, setting up and maintaining development environments, and automating tasks with `cron` and `at`.


Real-world projects will challenge you to apply your skills, from customizing your shell environment to managing server systems and synchronizing files remotely. Each module is crafted to ensure that you not only understand the concepts but can also implement them effectively. By the end of this training, you'll be equipped with advanced Linux skills that are crucial for efficient system management and development. Join us and unlock your full potential in the Linux world!

courses.title: Mac: From Zero to Almost Hero
courses.bio: Get to know your Mac and start using it effortlessly, so that you come closer to becoming a full Mac "Hero"

Zero: What are you going to learn?: Starting with a brand new Mac
First steps: Moving around: Finder: The first app you see
System Preferences: Setting yourself up: There are so many icons, which one do I click?
The Essentials: Which apps to use: Mac Stock Apps: The ones you get right away
App Store: Finding yourself some more
Browsing the internet with Safari and Chrome
Running Windows apps on a Mac
NTFS What? Connecting your devices and w: No Windows drives? How to work with NTFS
Power Tools: Let's speed things up: Terminal: There's no need to be scared
Alfred: More than just a better Spotlight
BetterTouchTool: Customize your keyboard and mouse

requirements: You should have access to a Mac computer or plan to own one in the future
courses.description:
I’ve been using a Mac for over 7 years now and every month I learn something new about it – how to solve a problem, an app I haven’t heard of before, or even how to type a specific symbol on the keyboard when I need it. And even while creating this course, although I knew what I wanted to talk about from the start, I stumbled upon several new things to me, and I want to share these insights with you, so that you get a head start and don’t have to gain this knowledge over the years like I did.
Many of my friends use macOS and whenever they ask me about, say, how I zoom in on a specific part of the screen or what that little Spotlight-like thing is (Alfred), I forget for a second that I didn’t know about these things a couple of years ago and that now it comes to me as second nature but not to them, so it is sometimes hard to explain even the seemingly simplest of concepts. But while designing this course, I took a step back and thought about all these things that I now do automatically and that would have helped me tremendously when I first started using a Mac, I asked around to see what other beginner users find difficult or annoying, and, on the other hand, what some more experienced users find useful and not entirely obvious at the first glance. I compiled these thoughts into this course, in which I want to give you an overview of macOS, teach you the basics of using a Mac, if you’re new to the system, and also show you the tips and tricks, solutions to most frequent problems, and insights into using a Mac, I’ve gathered over the years.
This 2-hour course is divided into five main sections, excluding introduction and conclusion:
“First Steps”, where you’ll find out how to move around your operating system, use Finder, and work with Spaces
“System Preferences”, where I’ll guide you through the ins and outs of this convoluted but absolutely essential app
“The Essentials”, where I’ll tell you something about the apps you already have, where to find more, and how to run apps from the internet or that are designed for Windows
“NTFS What?”, where you’ll learn how to connect your Windows drives and work with media, such as movies or pdf documents
“Power Tools”, where I’ll show you a few apps I hold very close to my heart and which let you greatly speed up your workflow
By the end of this course, you will have a very good overview of the entire system, you will know where to look when trying to solve a specific problem, be it a problem with your hard drive or just getting rid of the annoying large cursor which pops up when you move your mouse too fast. This course will in no way make you an expert on macOS, but no course will! To become an expert in anything, you need to put in your time and effort, and watching videos won’t ever be enough. But what this course can make you is an “almost hero”, or an “almost expert”, and this simply means that you’ll be well on your way to becoming a real “hero” or an “expert”, whichever sounds better to you.
To picture what this means, imagine a long list of features and keyboard shortcuts for an application like Adobe Photoshop. Knowing about these features and how to access them using your keyboard doesn’t make you an expert, that just makes you a well-informed user, who can choose which of these features interest them the most and focus on them. Knowing these features, knowing how to use them, and using them actively makes you an expert, but that’s exactly where you come into play. So let this course be something of an introduction of all these features for macOS, pointing out the ones which are more important and useful than others, and you decide, which are going to be of value to you and which you’re going to discard, and be on your way to becoming a real expert.
But I think that’s about enough of introduction and I’ll rather now let the course speak for itself. So browse through the curriculum to see a detailed overview of what you’re going to learn and get started!
target_audience: Anyone who wants to learn how to use a Mac from scratch
Anyone who already knows how to use a Mac but wants to become more proficient at it
Anyone who is switching to Mac from Windows or Linux

requirements: Basic computer knowledge
courses.description:
Active Directory is the heart of Windows Server user management and permissions. It's a key skill for any IT administrator and help desk staff.
The Active Directory Administrator is responsible for managing all aspects of the domain including the users, groups, and computer accounts in the domain. Creating, modifying, and deleting objects are some of the common tasks that the administrator in a typical domain network. The AD object management can be either done through Active Directory Users and Computers or through a number of tools, which allow the administrator to automate the administration.
The IT support roles usually get limited access to AD in this course we will cover the skills for IT support roles.
Danish Haider shows how to configure domain controller and account policies and maintain Active Directory. He'll cover  Active Directory basic tasks, password policy management, and other real-world tickets.


This course will also help students with preparing for technical Internews.
Students will gain hands-on experience if labs are used.
This course can be helpful for IT managers to train help desk staff for active directory management.
Hands-on lab
This sandbox solution can be used to practice and teach Windows server configuration and administration skills in a safe, secure environment. After completion of a session, the environment will reset back to its original state.
This Sandbox includes: Windows Server 2019 (Domain Member), Windows Server 2019 (Standalone Member), Windows 10 (Domain Member), Windows 10 (Standalone Member) and CentOS (Standalone Member).
Our Sandboxes provide a safe, secure virtual environment to test the impact of new installations or software updates prior to deployment. Connect to live Practice Labs servers, hardware and software in isolation from your critical business systems. Freestyle and experiment without risk to your in-house equipment or concerns about capacity.
target_audience: IT Beginners

courses.title: Linux Completo para Usuário Comum ou Desenvolvedor
courses.bio: Para de sofrer com seu Windows ou com o Linux que você até hoje não aprendeu a usar. Aprenda tudo sobre Linux aqui!
objectives: Você irá aprender a utilizar as principais distribuições Linux no seu dia a dia
Você irá aprender a realizar as principais operações de rotina em computadores com Linux
Você poderá substituir seu computador com Windows por um Linux com maior facilidade
Você poderá criar aplicações, jogar games, ouvir música, ver vídeos, navegar na Internet com seu Linux
requirements: Necessário ter feito o curso Programação para Leigos da Geek University ou ter conhecimentos equivalentes
Necessário querer aprender a usar o sistema Linux de forma simples e direta
Necessário querer  elevar seu nível de conhecimento em  sistemas operacionais
courses.description:
Graças ao Software Livre a tecnologia vem avançando a passos largos.
O primeiro grande projeto de software livre que ganhou status de gigante foi o Linux que atualmente está "rodando" em todos os top 500 supercomputadores (servidores de alto desempenho) do mundo, também em 80% dos smartphones do mundo (com o Android),
e até mesmo em outros planetas (em Marte nos rovers/robôs).
Se o sistema Windows é o sistema operacional mais utilizado no mundo é por conta do fato de que a maior parte dos usuários de computadores não utilizam computadores em nível profissional. A maior parte usa em atividades simples do dia-a-dia como navegando na Internet, ouvindo música, assistindo vídeos, criando documentos e etc.
Por outro lado temos uma minoria de usuários que utilizam computadores em nível profissional, como desenvolvedores de sistemas. Destes poucos usuários, parte utilizam Windows, parte utilizam Mac OS, parte utilizam Linux e parte utilizam outros sistemas operacionais.
Este curso pretende, de forma simples, rápida e direta, dar uma visão geral das principais distribuições Linux da atualidade, mostrando suas características, pontos fortes e fracos e ensinando, passo a passo desde a instalação e configuração até a utilização rotineira para os usuários comuns e também a utilização mais avançada para usuários que querem ou precisam utilizar o Linux para uso profissional no desenvolvimento de sistemas.
Este é o curso que eu queria ter feito em 1998 quando comecei a utilizar o sistema Linux.
Ao mesmo tempo, neste curso estão condensados cerca de 22 anos de conhecimento na utilização diária deste sistema, que fará
com que você, aluno Geek University esteja à frente, sempre.
Aprenda sobre:
- O que é o Linux?
- O Linux não é um Sistema Operacional!
- Interfaces Gráficas;
- Distribuições Linux (Instalação e Uso);
- Principais Ferramentas de uso Diário;
- Aprenda Linux de verdade!
- Linux para Gamers;
- Aprenda instalar League of Legends!
- E muito mais!
Evolua seu lado geek!
target_audience: Usuários de computadores comuns que realizam atividades rotineiras de navegação na Internet, ouvir músicas, ver vídeos, jogar e etc
Usuários de computadores profissionais que querem aprender a utilizar um sistema operacional de uso profissional
Usuários de computadores profissionais que já usam o Linux mas querem aprender de verdade a utilizá-lo

courses.title: Bash Beginners Course: Become a Bash Scripting Superhero!
courses.bio: Bash shell scripting course, where we will learn things like: writing a shell script, redirection, functions and more!

courses.description:
In this course I will teach you how to get started with bash scripting. We will learn the fundamentals of bash scripting and create an entire bash script in the end as our end project. Join the course!
We will learn thing such as how to write a shell script, variables, functions, exit codes and more! Here is a complete overview of all the topics:
Introduction
Basic commands
Writing your first bash script
Variables
Positional arguments
Output/Input redirection
Test operators
If/Elif/Else
Case statements
Arrays
For loop
Functions
Exit codes
AWK
SED
If you are completely new to bash scripting, don't worry! The course is made so that anyone can jump in. We work with WSL, for which I have a video on my YouTube channel (link in my profile page), so the course can be easily stepped into if you are on a Windows computer! If you don't know anything about the Linux shell, on don't know your way around a terminal, there is another course on here as well that explains the basics of Linux.
If you are already well rounded in Bash, you can have a look at the final project and see if you can manage to create it yourself!
Don't forget to check out my YouTube channel for more Linux related content. Have fun and happy studying!

courses.title: 【3週間で学ぶ】Bash シェルスクリプト実践講座！！初心者でも1からマスターする
courses.bio: ほとんどLinuxを使用したことのない方でも、Bashシェルスクリプトを完璧にマスターできます。Google Style Guideに基づいてシェルスクリプトをキレイに記述し、シェルスクリプトをカリキュラムに沿って計画的に勉強します
objectives: 業務で困らないレベルのLinuxコマンド、Bashシェルスクリプトの知識を身に付けることができます

クーロンの作成、systemctlでのサービス登録について学べます
vmstat, top, sarなどのリソース解析について学べます

cut, awk, xargsなどの文字列操作系コマンドについて詳しくなれます

【コーヒーブレイク】Teratermのカスタマイズ

echoコマンド、touchコマンド～その１～

mkdirコマンド、cdコマンド、pwdコマンド
mvコマンド、cpコマンド、catコマンド
rmdirコマンド、rmコマンド、whichコマンド

ショートカットコマンド～その２～

ファイル編集(viコマンド)～その２～
ファイル編集(viコマンド)～その３～
4日目 - ユーザー情報の更新と権限の変更: ユーザーの更新・削除（usermod, userdel）

if文でのファイルチェック

requirements: 特に経験は必要ないです。１から学習できます
courses.description:
この講座では、Linuxを扱ったことのない完全に初心者の方でも無理なく基礎的なコマンドから、シェルスクリプトの詳細までを勉強することができます。
Amazon Linux（EC2）を用いて、シェルスクリプトの作成方法を学びます。

3週間という期間で、実務レベルのシェルスクリプトを身に付けて頂きます。


【講座の特徴】
シェルスクリプトをマスターすることに特化した講座です
21日間の日付に分けて講義を行い、その日の進捗を管理しやすいです
経験をベースにしており、仕事で役立つ内容を実践で学ぶことができます
初心者でも理解することができ、1からマスターできます


以下の流れで勉強します。


1週目: Linuxの基礎
1週目は、まずLinuxの環境構築から、基礎的なコマンドをマスターして頂きます。環境はawsかVirtual Boxを使用します
1-1. 基礎コマンド、ショートカットコマンド、ファイル編集等
1-2. ユーザーの追加・削除
1-3. シェルスクリプトの変数の使い方

2週目: シェルスクリプト基礎
2週目は、シェルスクリプトの最も基本的な文法を中心に勉強します
2-1. 制御文: if
2-2. ループ文: for, while, until
2-3. ファイル入出力
2-4. 文字列操作コマンド: awk, cut等

3週目: シェルスクリプト応用
3週目は、シェルスクリプトの残りとして、case, select, 関数, trapを勉強して、マスターします
3-1. プロセスの起動と削除、バックグラウンド実行
3-2. case, select文
3-3. 関数の作成, trap, デバッグ
3-4. systemctl
3-5. DB, SQL


シェルスクリプトを作成することは、エンジニア必須の技術なので、この講座では文法だけでなく書き方も含めて詳細に取り上げました。
是非、マスターしましょう。
target_audience: Linuxを仕事や学校で利用する初心者エンジニアの方

courses.title: From Novice to Ninja: Linux Basics for Everyone
courses.bio: Linux Essentials: Everything You Need to Know to Get Started in 2023
requirements: No previous background is required
courses.description:
Linux is a powerful open-source Unix-like operating system that has been around since 1991 when Linus Torvalds first published the Linux kernel. Today, Linux is widely used and distributed as a package, making it accessible to users around the world.
If you're new to Linux, this introductory course is designed to give you a comprehensive overview of the operating system, including how to install and use it on your computer, as well as an introduction to its command line fundamentals.
This hands-on training will guide you through each topic, providing clear explanations and real-world examples to help you build a strong foundation in Linux. All you need to get started is a computer running Mac or Windows and a pair of headphones.
Throughout the course, we'll cover a range of topics, including what Linux is, how to set up a virtual Linux machine using VirtualBox, the most commonly used Linux commands, and free alternative software to Window's famous daily usage tools.
This course is perfect for beginners who are unfamiliar with Linux and want to learn its fundamentals via the shell's command line. It's not intended for intermediate or advanced Linux users, so if you're just starting out, this is the course for you. Get ready to dive into the exciting world of Linux and start building your skills today!
target_audience: Beginners starting to learn Linux

courses.description:
Linux Administration Course 1
This course covers essential topics and skills for becoming proficient in Linux system administration:


Week 1: Introduction to Linux Administration


Session 1: Linux Basics and Installation
Introduction to Linux and its distributions
Understanding the Linux file system hierarchy
Installation of a Linux distribution (e.g., Ubuntu or CentOS)


Session 2: Command-Line Essentials
Navigating the command line interface (CLI)

Text processing commands (grep, sed, awk)


Session 3: User and Group Management

Password policies and security considerations


Week 2: System Configuration and Maintenance

Installing, updating, and removing software packages


Session 5: File System Management

Session 6: Process Management

Week 3: Networking and Security

Session 8: Firewall and Security

Basic firewall rules and configurations

courses.title: Implementing Residual Networks from Scratch to training
courses.bio: Building and Training ResNet Models in PyTorch – A Complete Guide
objectives: Implement custom Residual Blocks and ResNet architectures (ResNet50, ResNet101, ResNet152) from scratch using PyTorch.
Prepare and preprocess image datasets with normalization, resizing, data augmentation, and efficient DataLoader creation.
Write and optimize complete training and validation loops including loss calculation, accuracy measurement, and GPU acceleration.
Compare and analyze model performance with and without residual connections to understand their effect on deep network training.

Introduction: 4. How a ResidualBlock Transforms Input Tensors — PyTorch Demo
5. Deep Dive into Residual Blocks : Implementing Residual Blocks in PyTorch
6. Implementing Residual Block Sequences with Downsampling in PyTorch
7. How ResNet Processes Data: Step-by-Step Forward Method Explained
8. Step-by-Step Guide to Dataset Loading and Augmentation with PyTorch
9. Training Deep Learning Models in PyTorch: Step-by-Step Guide
10. Training ResNet Models on GPU: Residuals vs No Residuals Explained
11. setting up kaggle dataset and visualizing graph

requirements: python
courses.description:
This hands-on course takes you step-by-step through building, understanding, and training Residual Networks (ResNet) in PyTorch entirely from scratch. You will not only learn how ResNet works under the hood but also gain practical skills to implement and customize it for real-world image classification tasks.
By the end of the course, you will:
Understand the concept of Residual Blocks and why skip connections solve the vanishing gradient problem.
Implement custom ResNet architectures (ResNet50, ResNet101, ResNet152) directly in PyTorch without relying on pre-built libraries.
Prepare and preprocess image datasets (Cats vs Dogs) using transforms, normalization, and data augmentation.
Split datasets into training and validation sets and create efficient DataLoaders.
Write a full model training loop from scratch, including forward propagation, backpropagation, loss calculation, and optimizer updates.
Evaluate model performance with accuracy and loss tracking for both training and validation.
Compare training results with and without residual connections to see their impact on performance.
Utilize GPU acceleration in PyTorch for faster model training.
Whether you are a beginner looking to understand convolutional neural networks or an intermediate learner aiming to deepen your PyTorch skills, this course will equip you with both the theory and coding expertise needed to implement advanced deep learning models.
target_audience: all levels python programmers

courses.title: Certified Information Privacy Manager - (CIPM)
courses.bio: Practical guidance and exam preparation for CIPM certification, focusing on privacy program management.
courses.description:
Key Benefits of This Test – CIPM (Certified Information Privacy Manager)
Learn to design, build, and manage an effective privacy program within any organization.
Gain practical skills to bridge legal requirements with operational implementation.
Understand how to conduct Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) and DPIAs.
Develop expertise in vendor and third-party risk management.
Access exam-focused strategies and practice questions to pass the CIPM certification.
Position yourself as a leader in privacy management and compliance operations.


This test is designed to comprehensively prepare learners for the Certified Information Privacy Manager (CIPM) exam, the internationally recognized credential for privacy program management. CIPM certification validates your expertise in managing, implementing, and maintaining privacy programs aligned with global privacy regulations, including GDPR, CCPA, and other international emerging frameworks.
Whether you are a Data Protection Officer (DPO), privacy professional, compliance officer, aspiring privacy manager, or more, this test provides structured guidance to help you succeed. Learners will gain practical knowledge in privacy governance, risk management, program development, operational compliance, and monitoring, along with strategies for passing the CIPM exam.
The test are includes case studies, practice questions, interactive exercises, and program management simulations, helping learners bridge theory with real-world application. You will learn about how to develop privacy policies, conduct data protection impact assessments, implement accountability measures, and evaluate organizational privacy readiness.
By taking this test, you will:

FSMO Rolleri Nedir? Hangileri Kritik Öneme Sahiptir?
Domain ve Forest Functional Levels Kavramları

requirements: Bu eğitime katılmak için temel düzeyde ağ bilgisi, Windows server ve client işletim sistemi, kullanıcı ve grup mantığı konularında bilgi sahibi olmanız eğitimi daha verimli geçirmenizi sağlayacaktır.
courses.description:
Active Directory, modern bir ağ ortamında kullanıcıların, bilgisayarların ve diğer kaynakların yönetimini kolaylaştıran Microsoft'un kilit öneme sahip bir bileşenidir. Bu eğitim, Active Directory'nin temel kavramlarından başlayarak, kullanıcıların ve kaynakların etkin bir şekilde yönetilmesini sağlayan önemli özelliklerine kadar geniş bir yelpazeyi kapsar.
Eğitimin ilk bölümünde Active Directory'nin ne olduğunu ve nasıl çalıştığını anlamak için temel kavramlar incelenir. Active Directory'nin fiziksel ve mantıksal yapısı, kullanıcı hesapları, gruplar, bilgisayar nesneleri ve diğer önemli bileşenler detaylı olarak ele alınır.
İkinci bölümde, Active Directory'nin önemli özellikleri ve faydaları üzerinde durulur. Bunlar arasında tek oturum açma (Single Sign-On), güvenlik ve erişim kontrolü, grup politikaları yönetimi ve merkezi veri depolama gibi konular yer alır.
Üçüncü bölüm, Active Directory'nin temel yapı taşlarına odaklanır. FSMO (Flexible Single Master Operation) rolleri ve bunların ağ yönetimindeki kritik rolü incelenir. Ayrıca, Global Catalog, Active Directory veritabanı partisyon yapısı ve diğer önemli bileşenler detaylı olarak ele alınır.
Son bölümde ise, Active Directory ortamında kullanılan temel kavramlar açıklanır. Domain, Domain Controller, Site, OU (Organizational Unit), Child Domain, Tree ve Forest gibi kavramlar üzerinde durularak, bunların birbirleriyle nasıl ilişkili olduğu ve ağ yönetiminde nasıl kullanıldığı anlatılır.
Bu eğitim, bilgi teknolojileri alanında çalışan veya bu alanda kariyer yapmak isteyenler için önemli bir kaynaktır. Active Directory'nin temel prensiplerini anlamak ve uygulamak, bir kuruluşun ağ yönetimini etkinleştirmek ve güvenliğini sağlamak için gereklidir. Bu eğitim, katılımcılara bu konuda sağlam bir temel sağlayarak, profesyonel becerilerini geliştirmelerine yardımcı olur.
target_audience: Active Directory konusunda bilgi sahibi olmak isteyen veya bilgilerini geliştirmek isteyen sistem yöneticilerinin katılmasının faydalı olacağını düşünüyorum

objectives: Install, configure, and manage Windows Server 2025
