courses.title: Master Bash Commands in Linux & Unix Terminals with WSL
courses.bio: Learn essential Bash commands, file operations, Linux user management, and WSL setup
objectives: Understand what Bash is and explain its role in the Linux operating system.
Set up a Linux environment on Windows using Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).
Install and configure a Linux distribution step by step.
Recognize the structure of the Linux command prompt and its components.
Navigate the Linux file system using commands like ls, cd, and pwd.
Create, copy, move, and delete files and directories using Bash commands.
View and combine file contents with commands such as cat and echo.
Access and use Linux manual pages with the man command for self-guided learning.
Visualize directory structures using the tree command.
Use grep to search for patterns and extract useful information from files.
Apply pipes and redirection operators to control and combine command outputs.
Manage users by understanding root, system, and regular accounts.
Organize and control permissions using user groups.
Retrieve and display detailed user account information.
Practice safe file and directory removal using rm and rmdir.
Gain confidence working in a terminal-based environment.
Develop a solid foundation for more advanced Linux and shell scripting skills.

Introduction: Introduction – Course overview and what to expect.
What is Bash? – Understanding the shell and its role in Linux
What is WSL? – Running Linux on Windows with Windows Subsystem for Linux.
Installing Linux (Part 1) – Setting up Linux on your system.
Installing Linux (Part 2) – Completing installation and verifying setup.
Essential Bash Commands in Linux & Unix: The Linux Prompt – Understanding the command prompt and its structure.
The ls Command – Listing files and directories.
The cd Command – Navigating the filesystem.
The pwd Command – Displaying your current location.
The mkdir Command – Creating new directories.
The cat Command – Viewing and combining file contents.
The cp Command – Copying files and directories.
The rm Command – Removing files safely.
The su Command – Switching users and managing privileges.
The clear Command – Cleaning up your terminal view.
The echo Command – Displaying text and variables.
The tree Command – Visualizing directory structures.
Pipes and Redirect Operators – Controlling and combining command outputs.
Types of User Accounts – Root, system, and regular users explained
User Groups in Linux/Unix – Organizing users and managing access.
Viewing User Information – Listing accounts and retrieving user details.

requirements: Basic computer literacy – comfort with installing software, navigating folders, and using a keyboard and mouse.
A Windows 10 or Windows 11 PC – required for setting up Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).
Administrator rights on your computer – needed to install Linux via WSL.
An internet connection – for downloading Linux distributions and updates.
Curiosity and willingness to learn – the most important requirement!
courses.description:
Are you ready to unlock the power of Linux and the Bash command line? Whether you’re an absolute beginner or someone with basic experience looking to sharpen your skills, this course is designed to give you a strong, practical foundation in one of the most widely used tools in computing today.
The Linux command line might look intimidating at first, but once you understand its structure and commands, you’ll discover just how powerful and efficient it can be. This course will walk you step by step through the essentials, giving you both the confidence and hands-on knowledge to navigate, manage, and control your Linux environment with ease.
We’ll begin by setting up your environment. You’ll learn what Bash is, why it matters, and how it fits into the Linux operating system. We’ll also explore Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), a simple way to run Linux directly on Windows without needing extra hardware or complicated setups. You’ll install Linux on your own system, verify that everything is running smoothly, and gain a clear understanding of the Linux prompt — the gateway to mastering the command line.
Once your environment is ready, we’ll dive into the heart of the course: essential Bash commands. From navigating the file system with ls and cd to working with files using cp, mv, and rm, you’ll build the skills needed to handle everyday tasks efficiently. You’ll also explore tools like grep for searching text, man for accessing documentation, and tree for visualizing directories. These commands aren’t just theoretical—you’ll practice them with guided examples, ensuring you know not just what they do, but how to use them effectively in real-world scenarios.
We’ll also cover pipes and redirection, powerful operators that let you combine commands, control outputs, and automate tasks. These are the building blocks of creating more advanced scripts and workflows, giving you a taste of just how flexible the Linux shell can be.
In addition to commands, you’ll learn about user accounts and groups in Linux. We’ll explain the difference between root, system, and regular users, how groups help organize access and permissions, and how to view user information. Understanding user management is a key part of working securely in Linux, whether you’re managing your own system or collaborating in a larger environment.
By the end of this course, you will:
Understand the role of Bash and WSL in running Linux
Set up and configure Linux on your Windows machine
Confidently navigate the Linux file system
Use essential Bash commands to manage files, directories, and processes
Leverage pipes and redirection to combine commands
Understand user accounts, groups, and permissions
This course is perfect for:
Beginners who want a guided introduction to Linux and Bash
Developers, IT professionals, and students seeking practical command line skills
Anyone curious about Linux but unsure where to start
No prior experience is required—just curiosity and a willingness to learn. By the time you finish, you’ll have the practical knowledge to start using Linux and Bash confidently in your own projects.
target_audience: Beginners who want a guided introduction to Linux and Bash
Developers, IT professionals, and students seeking practical command line skills
Anyone curious about Linux but unsure where to start

courses.title: Master 120+ Linux Commands Line Certification and Interview
courses.bio: Prepare for interviews and certifications on file management, user permissions, shell scripting, networking, and more
courses.description:
Welcome to Master 120+ Linux Commands Line Certification and Interview ! This course is designed to equip you with the knowledge and practical skills needed to excel in Linux command line-based interviews and certification exams. Whether you are preparing for a job interview, a certification test, or simply want to strengthen your Linux skills, this course offers a comprehensive and structured approach to mastering essential Linux concepts.
Course Overview:
This course is tailored to help you gain a deep understanding of the Linux command line. We cover a wide range of topics with over 90 questions to test your knowledge and ensure you’re ready for real-world applications. From file management and user permissions to shell scripting and networking, you’ll learn the most critical commands and concepts that are essential for anyone working with Linux systems.
Content Outline:
File Management Essentials
Master key file management commands like ls, cp, mv, rm, mkdir, and rmdir.
Learn how to navigate the Linux file system and manage files and directories effectively.
Understand file permissions, ownership, and how to secure files using chmod, chown, and chgrp.
Work with symbolic and hard links to optimize file organization.
User Permissions and Ownership
Dive into Linux permissions, including read, write, and execute for users, groups, and others.
Learn how to manage users and groups with commands like useradd, groupadd, and usermod.
Understand how to modify file access control lists (ACLs) and enforce security policies.
Explore sudo privileges and the visudo command for managing root access and security.
Shell Scripting Basics
Explore the world of shell scripting and automation.
Learn how to write and execute basic shell scripts using variables, loops, and conditionals.
Understand the power of shell scripting in automating everyday tasks and processes.
Get hands-on experience with script debugging, error handling, and output redirection.
Networking Commands
Understand essential networking concepts and tools used in Linux.
Get hands-on experience with commands like ping, ifconfig, netstat, and ssh for networking diagnostics and remote management.
Learn how to troubleshoot network issues and manage network connections with traceroute, nslookup, and route.
Work with network services like ftp, scp, and rsync for secure file transfers.
Process Management and System Monitoring
Understand how to manage processes using commands like ps, top, kill, and htop.
Learn to monitor system performance with tools like vmstat, iostat, sar, and uptime.
Explore job control commands (bg, fg, jobs, kill) and how to manage background tasks.
Get familiar with system logs and troubleshooting techniques using journalctl and dmesg.
Package Management and Software Installation
Learn to manage software packages using package managers like apt, yum, dnf, and pacman.
Understand the process of installing, updating, and removing software packages in different Linux distributions.
Explore dependency management and how to resolve package conflicts.
Learn how to compile and install software from source code and manage custom installations.
By the end of this course, you’ll have the confidence to navigate the Linux command line, manage files and users, write shell scripts, and tackle networking tasks with ease. You’ll be ready for both certification exams and real-world job interviews. Join today and start mastering Linux commands!
target_audience: Absolute beginners looking to learn Linux commands
Individuals preparing for interviews or certifications in Linux.
Anyone wanting to enhance their technical skills in a Linux environment.
Students interested in developing skills for IT or system administration.

courses.description:
Welcome to an exciting journey into the world of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Terraform!

In today's tech-driven era, understanding how to manage infrastructure efficiently and effectively is a superpower that can set you apart in the ever-evolving digital landscape.

Throughout this course, we'll embark on an adventure from the basics to advanced techniques of Infrastructure as Code, all while keeping the learning experience engaging, interactive, and most importantly, fun!

By the end of this adventure, you'll be equipped with the skills and knowledge to design, deploy, and manage your cloud infrastructure on AWS using Terraform. You'll be able to automate tasks, speed up deployments, and impress your peers with your newfound superpowers!


Automating tasks like a pro and orchestrating your infrastructure with Terraform
Designing architectures that are scalable and resilient, making you the superhero of the cloud
Keeping an eye on your infrastructure, testing it, and fixing bugs like a true tech wizard
Embracing DevOps practices for continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) like a boss


Whether you're dreaming of becoming a developer, a system administrator, a tech entrepreneur, or just curious about the world of cloud computing, this course is your gateway to unlocking endless possibilities in the digital realm. So, what are you waiting for? Join us on this epic journey into Infrastructure as Code with AWS and Terraform, and let's make some tech magic together!
target_audience: Beginners: If you're new and you would like to get to know Terraform and AWS but you dont have much time, this course is for you!

courses.title: Flume- Ingesting Data into Hadoop through Flume
courses.bio: Data Ingestion tool to hadoop

Why Where What and How of Flume: Prerequisites and How to make best out of this course
Section 3: source Spool Dir, channel file , sink another channel
Exercise-1 : Exec Source,file Channel, and HDFS sink
Exercise-2 : Spool Source, Memory Channel,HDFS sink with Load Date

requirements: Basic Idea about HDFS and Hadoop
courses.description:
Flume is a distributed, reliable, and available service for efficiently collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data. It has a simple and flexible architecture based on streaming data flows. It is robust and fault tolerant with tunable reliability mechanisms and many failover and recovery mechanisms. It uses a simple extensible data model that allows for online analytic application.
And here's my promise to you. I promise that in the next couple of hours I will teach you to build things that might take you weeks to learn on your own and we will create together a Flume Ingestion and configuration experience   It's not going to be a fully advanced and complete application set up, but it will be an amazing start to understand Flume.
Please try to do exercises and configure Flume agent and Once you are comfortable, Please submit them for my review. After couple of months, I will put in couple of more video tutorials for the exercise files.
target_audience: Any one interested to learn about Big Data and Data ingestion standards and Loading data into Hadoop
Hadoop Administrators, Hadoop Support resources, Hadoop developers, Hadoop Managers

Why would you choose to learn Java?
The reality is that there is a lot of computer languages out there. It's in the hundreds. Why would you choose the Java language?
The number one reason is its popularity. According to many official websites that track the popularity of languages, Java is either #1 or in the top 3. Popularity means more companies and their staff are using it, so there are more career opportunities available for you if you are skilled in the language.
The last thing you want to do is pick a language that is not in mainstream use. Java came out in the 1990s and is still very popular today.

courses.title: Aprende Unit Test en Java con Junit 5 y Mockito
courses.bio: Los Test Unitarios son fundamentales para desarrollar aplicaciones robustas y JUnit 5 y Mockito son ideales para Java
objectives: Aprenderás a realizar Test Unitarios con JUnit 5 y Mockito
El framework JUnit 5 para test unitarios
El framework Mocktio para test unitarios
¿Qué es un Mock y como nos facilita la vida haciendo test?
Aplicaciones más robustas
Aprende a programar sin Bugs

Mockito: Patrón de Pruebas para Mock Parte2

requirements: Debes tener conocimientos de programación en Java. Que es un Clase, Interfaz, Programación Orientada a Objetos.
courses.description:
Hoy en día las pruebas unitarias son fundamentales para desarrollar aplicaciones robustas puesto que los test unitarios nos permiten comprobar que una unidad de código funciona como debería. Al desarrollar tus aplicaciones Java con los test unitarios te aseguras que cada unidad funciona como debe. Si quieres trabajar como desarrollador Java uno de los requisitos básicos es tener conocimientos en Unit Test y con este curso aprenderás lo fundamental.
Las ventajas de hacer pruebas unitarias en nuestro código son muchas, pero las principales son:
Calidad de Código
Entregamos código con menos bugs
Proporcionamos documentación del código
Proceso de debugeado del código
Nos da garantías a la hora de refactorizar
Es más económico
JUnit 5 es el Framework de test unitarios más usado en Java y durante este curso aprenderás a usarlo:
Aprenderás a crear un proyecto que use JUnit 5 desde cero.
Aprenderás a utilizar los diferentes tipos de Assert que nos ofrece JUnit.
Aprenderás a utilizar las anotaciones @Test, @BeforeEach, @AfterEach y muchísimas que nos ofrece el framework
Aprenderás por que es fundamental hacer test unitarios
Mockito es un Framework de Mock que funciona muy bien en Java.
Aprenderás que es un Stub, Mock y Spy
Aprenderás los beneficios de utilizar Mocks
Podrás testear métodos que no devuelven nada
Aprenderás a utilizar las anotaciones @Mock, @InjectMocks, @Spy, @Captor y muchas otras.
Aprenderás a testear partes complejas como Callbacks
Escribirás test muy fáciles de leer y entender
Accede a ofertas de trabajo mejores para desarrolladores Java añadiendo este nuevo conocimiento a tu forma de programar. Apúntate ahora.
target_audience: Desarrolladores Java que se quieren aprender a testear sus aplicaciones

courses.title: Hands-On Introduction to Web Serving with NGINX
courses.bio: Learn to serve websites and apps using NGINX with a hands-on approach — from setup to load balancing and HTTP
requirements: Basic familiarity with Linux command line
A computer with internet access
(Optional) An AWS account and a domain name for HTTPS demo
courses.description:
Welcome to Hands-On Introduction to Web Serving with NGINX — a practical and beginner-friendly course designed to help you understand how modern websites and apps are actually served to users.
I’m Lucas, a tech lead in an international team, and I've created this course to give you the skills and confidence to start using NGINX in real-world scenarios — no slides, just hands-on practice in your terminal and browser.
In this course, you’ll learn:
What a web server is and why NGINX is so widely used
How to set up a Linux-based environment with NGINX installed
How to serve static websites and reverse proxy to backend applications like Node.js
How to load balance across multiple backend servers
How to set up a domain name with Route 53 and secure your site with HTTPS using Let’s Encrypt in the Cloud (AWS)
How to password-protect parts of your site and restrict access by IP address
How to read logs and troubleshoot issues using tail, journalctl, and browser developer tools
So if you're just getting started with DevOps or want to understand how servers handle web traffic, this course walks you through it all — step by step.
By the end, you’ll know how to serve and secure real applications with NGINX and feel ready to explore more advanced topics.
target_audience: Beginners who want to understand how web servers like NGINX work
Developers deploying their first web apps
DevOps or sysadmin learners who want practical NGINX experience
Anyone looking to secure and manage their web traffic hands-on

Neste curso são tratadas diversas funções de um dos sistemas operacionais mais utilizados em servidores de empresas de qualquer porte, o Windows Server 2012 R2. O sistema da Microsoft voltado ao ambiente empresarial, especificamente servidores, possui diversas funções bem interessantes para qualquer administrador de sistemas.

No curso são abordados assuntos como licenciamento, instalação e configuração do Windows Server 2012 R2, instalação e configuração do Active Directory, assim como criação de Unidades Organizacionais, usuários e grupos de usuários, controlador de domínio, servidor de arquivos, firewall do Windows, GPO e serviços como DNS, DHCP e o popular virtualizador Hyper-V.

Élevez vos compétences en informatique au niveau supérieur avec notre cours 'Maîtrisez Windows Server : Votre Guide Vers l'Expertise en Administration Système'. Cette formation approfondie vous guide à travers les aspects avancés de Windows Server, vous permettant de développer une compréhension profonde et des compétences en administration système.
Le cours s'appuie sur vos connaissances existantes de Windows Server et les développe pour couvrir des domaines tels que la configuration avancée, l'optimisation du système, l'administration de la sécurité et la gestion de l'infrastructure réseau. Que vous soyez un professionnel de l'informatique cherchant à affiner ses compétences ou un administrateur de serveur expérimenté désirant se mettre à jour sur les dernières versions de Windows Server, ce cours vous fournira les outils nécessaires pour réussir.
Le cours est structuré de manière à vous offrir une approche pratique de l'apprentissage, avec de nombreux exemples en temps réel et des études de cas pour illustrer les concepts. Par ailleurs, nous abordons tous les éléments requis pour l'examen d'administration avancée de Windows Server, vous mettant sur la voie pour obtenir votre certification.
'Maîtrisez Windows Server : Votre Guide Vers l'Expertise en Administration Système' est votre ticket pour une carrière réussie dans l'administration système. N'attendez plus, inscrivez-vous dès maintenant !

courses.title: AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions
courses.bio: Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions Designing Exam
courses.description:
This course is designed to prepare learners for the AZ-305 certification exam by providing comprehensive coverage of Microsoft Azure infrastructure solutions design principles and best practices. The course features 6 realistic practice tests with 552 questions in total, each with feedback to help learners identify areas of weakness and improve their performance.
The course content is structured around the key topics covered in the AZ-305 exam, including resource group planning, virtual machine sizing, networking considerations, security, and compliance. Learners will also gain hands-on experience designing scalable and resilient Azure solutions using various Azure services such as Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Virtual Machines.
By the end of the course, learners will have a strong understanding of Azure infrastructure design principles, the ability to design and implement highly scalable and resilient Azure solutions, and a solid grasp of Azure security and compliance best practices. Additionally, learners will be well-prepared for the AZ-305 certification exam and will have completed extensive practice tests to ensure their success.
You won't be hoping you are ready, you will know you are ready to sit for and pass the exam. After practicing these tests and scoring a 75% or higher on them, you will be ready to PASS on the first attempt and avoid costly re-schedule fees, saving you time and money.
Whether you're an IT professional, solution architect, or developer, this course is your ticket to mastering the art of designing effective Microsoft Azure infrastructure solutions. It is particularly recommended for those who are preparing for the AZ-305 certification exam and want to ensure they are fully prepared for the exam's challenging questions.
So what are you waiting for? Buy this course today and become an Azure infrastructure design superstar!
Don't forget that AZ-305 Azure Infrastructure Solution Implementation certification is the best proof of your expertise in Azure.
target_audience: Anyone

courses.title: SQL for Beginners with Real Projects
courses.bio: Learn SQL step-by-step with hands-on projects — build real-world skills in querying, analyzing, and managing data.
objectives: Understand the fundamentals of SQL and relational databases.
Write basic to intermediate SQL queries to retrieve and analyze data.
Apply SQL skills to real-world projects using sample databases.
Use SQL to clean, filter, and organize data for reporting and insights.
Gain the confidence to use SQL in professional environments such as business, data analysis, or software development.
requirements: No prior SQL or programming experience required.
Basic computer and internet skills (installing software, navigating files).
A willingness to learn through hands-on practice with real projects.
courses.description:
Data is the backbone of every business today, and SQL (Structured Query Language) is the universal language used to manage and analyze it. Whether you want to launch a career in data analysis, work with databases in software development, or simply understand how to turn raw information into meaningful insights, SQL is a skill you can’t afford to ignore.
This beginner-friendly course, SQL for Beginners with Real Projects, is designed to take you from absolute basics to confidently writing and running SQL queries. But unlike many courses that focus only on theory, this one is hands-on — you’ll be working on real projects and practical examples that mirror the kind of problems professionals solve every day.
Here’s what you’ll learn:
How databases work and why SQL is essential.
Writing queries to retrieve, filter, and sort information.
Using JOINs to combine data from multiple tables.
Aggregating, grouping, and summarizing data for reports.
Applying SQL skills to real projects that simulate business use cases.
No prior programming or database experience is required. Each topic is explained step by step, and exercises will give you immediate practice. This course was partially created with the assistance of AI tools to ensure clear, structured, and beginner-friendly content.
By the end of this course, you’ll not only understand SQL syntax but also know how to apply it in real-world scenarios, making you more confident, more employable, and ready to add SQL to your professional toolkit.
target_audience: Absolute beginners who want to learn SQL from scratch.
Students and professionals looking to improve their data analysis skills.
Business analysts, marketers, and managers who want to work more effectively with data.
Aspiring data scientists, software developers, or IT professionals seeking a strong SQL foundation.

requirements: Administración de Sistemas Operativos Windows
Instalación de Sistemas Operativos

courses.description:
=> ACTUALIZACIONES <=
Todo lo que administras por interfaz gráfica en el fondo se hace con PowerShell
Windows PowerShell es un lenguaje de scripting y shell de línea de comandos basado en tareas diseñado especialmente para la administración del sistema. Creado con Microsoft .NET Framework, Windows PowerShell ayuda a los profesionales de TI y a los usuarios experimentados a controlar y automatizar la administración tanto del sistema operativo Windows como de las aplicaciones que se ejecutan en Windows.
Como administradores de TI en servidores y equipos clientes PowerShell es la herramienta predilecta para realizar la administración rápida y automatizada, TODO lo que tu ejecutas en la internas gráfica corre por debajo con PowerShell. Todos los productos y/o soluciones creadas por Microsoft utilizan PowerShell y en muchas de ellas existen procedimientos que no se pueden realizar por interfaz gráfica y que solo se pueden realizar con PowerShell.
En este curso nos iniciaremos en la administración de Sistemas Operativos Windows desde la línea de comandos, dejando atrás los comandos que conocíamos en símbolo del sistema o CMD y pasando a los Cmdlets de PowerShell, esto nos servirá para administrar tanto servidores con Windows Server 2016 y 2019 como equipos clientes con Windows 10
Ahh se me olvidaba, también existe PowerShell para Linux :D

courses.bio: In diesem Kurs lernen Sie die ersten Schritte mit Windows Server 2019/2022 kennen. Von der Installation bis zum Betrieb.
objectives: Erste Schritte mit Windows Server
Was ist der Unterschied zwischen Windows Client und Server Betriebssystemen ?

Lizensierung

Installation eines Windows Server Betrie: Aufbau einer Test-Umgebung mit einer Virtualisierungssoftware
Windows Server kennenlernen: Exchange Server, SharePoint und weitere Produkte für Windows Server
Active Directory Domänendienste: Wir sehen uns um. Was hat sich nach dem Hochstufen verändert ?
Server02 und Client01 in die Domäne einbinden
Netzwerkdienste mit Windows Server berei: DNS auf Server02 manuell einrichten und Zonentransfer durchführen

requirements: Keine Windows Server Vorkenntnisse nötig
Erfahrung mit Windows 10 oder Windows 11 im professionellen Umfeld
Grundlegende Kenntnisse der Netzwerktechnik
Von Vorteil: Ein Windows 10 oder 11 Computer (Pro, Enterprise) mit Hyper-V
courses.description:
In diesem Einsteigerkurs starten wir "from the very beginning". Wir machen uns Gedanken über den Unterschied zwischen Windows Client- und Server Betriebssystemen. Windows Server kann auch in der Cloud betrieben werden. Worin besteht der Unterschied zwischen dem Betrieb in der Cloud und On-Premise ("im Haus") und welche Kosten kommen auf uns zu?
Nach dem Herunterladen einer Evaluierungsversion ("Testversion") stürzen wir uns direkt in das Thema Installation und installieren einen Windows Server 2019/2022 in einer Testumgebung mithilfe der Virtualisierungssoftware Hyper-V.
Wir werden unseren Windows Server von Grund auf konfigurieren und lernen wie man Server-Rollen und Features installiert. Nach der Installation der Rolle Active Directory Domänendienste und dem Hinaufstufen des Windows Server zum Domain-Controller "bauen" wir uns gemeinsam eine Test-Umgebung mit weiteren Computern und Servern. Das Thema der Administration von Active Directory mit deren Benutzern, Computern und Gruppen wird in diesem Kurs nicht zu kurz kommen.
Active Directory wird ohne DNS nicht funktionieren, daher legen wir auch einen Augenmerk auf einen der wichtigsten Dienste: DNS. Um unsere Client-Computer mit IP-Adressen versorgen zu können werden wir einen weiteren wichtigen Dienst installieren: DHCP.
Unsere Client-Computer sollten Richtlinien befolgen und diese werden wir mithilfe von Gruppenrichtlinien konfigurieren. Benutzer müssen auch auf Files zugreifen können und drucken können. Daher installieren und konfigurieren wir die File-Server und Druck-Server Rolle. Zum Schluss sollten wir unseren Windows Server absichern. Wir lernen das Windows Server Backup "On-Premise", sowie in der Cloud kennen und werden ein Backup eines Ordners durchführen. Das Thema Windows Updates auf einem Server Betriebssystem rundet das Thema ab.
Ich wünsche viel Spaß beim Kurs und freue mich auf spannende Stunden!
target_audience: IT-Mitarbeiter welche Windows Server kennenlernen möchten
Helpdesk-Mitarbeiter
Netzwerktechniker
Client-Support Mitarbeiter
Personen mit Interesse an Windows Server

requirements: Podstawy administracji systemu Windows
Podstawy umiejętności programowania (znajomość pojęcia zmienna, typ, pętla, intrukcja warunkowa, obiekt, metoda, funkcja itp)
courses.description:
Zaawansowany kurs od podstaw nauczy cię tego, co każdy administrator Windows powinien wiedzieć, aby wydajnie pracować z Powershell.

W zarządzaniu systemami liczy się to aby zrobić to co jest do zrobienia, ale zbytnio się przy tym nie napracować, zautomatyzować co się da. Zamiast tylko korzystać z gotowych narzędzi, budować je sobie samemu. Tego właśnie możesz się nauczyć na tym kursie, a nie muszę chyba mówić o tym, jak cenne są te umiejętności.
Zaczniemy od podstaw, opowiemy o tym, co to jest PowerShell, jak go zainstalować, z jakich narzędzi korzystać, jak uruchamiać podstawowe polecenia, jak czytać dokumentację. Zobaczysz nie tylko, jak prawidłowo korzystać z poleceń, ale też, jakie błędy można popełnić, jak przeanalizować wyświetlany wtedy komunikat i jak taki problem rozwiązać.
Krok po kroku przejdziemy przez szereg poleceń, ich argumentów, wyjaśnimy, jak działają potoki, jak budować wyrażenia, jak filtrować wyniki, budować skrypty, formatować dane, korzystać z WMI i CIM, jak obsługiwać błędy, pracować ze zmiennymi, tworzyć pętle, konfigurować bezpieczeństwo skryptów, tworzyć funkcje i moduły, jak wykonywać skrypty zdalnie przez remoting, jak tworzyć zadania w harmonogramie zadań, jak pracować z rejestrem i jak konfigurować środowisko pracy.
Do dyspozycji dostajesz: krótkie filmy z demonstracją, quiz po każdej lekcji, co przyda się do utrwalenia wiadomości, zadania do samodzielnego wykonania i propozycję rozwiązania tych zadań. Oprócz tego możesz pobrać podręcznik PDF do kursu zawierający notatki do każdej lekcji oraz pobrać z GitHub-a repozytorium z kodem demonstracji.
Kończąc kurs będziesz mieć w swoich rękach nową cenną umiejętność. Zostaniesz skrypterem, gotowym do automatyzacji tak potrzebnej zarówno w administracji, jak i w DevOps.
Zostań mistrzem linii poleceń! Oskryptuj powtarzalne zadania. Ceń swój czas!
Zapraszam na kurs!
Twój trener, Rafał


ISBN: 978-83-945846-0-3

courses.title: Cloud Computing for Complete Beginners [ AWS , Wordpress ]
courses.bio: Building and Scaling High-Performance Web Servers on the Amazon Cloud [ AWS, Wordpress, Linux, Ubuntu ]

Choosing and Starting Up Your Server: Choosing and Starting Up Your Server
Installing and Configuring Your Server S: Telling Apache to use Your WordPress Installation
Setting Up a Static IP Address for Your: Fixing WordPress after an IP Change

requirements: No prior experience required

Note that this course does not teach you programming or website design. It teaches you how to create, manage and scale web servers, and it even shows you how to create a working WordPress installation that you can edit and publish stuff on.
courses.description:
This course is the course I wish I had when I started managing my own web servers for the businesses I own. Due to the complexity of the technologies involved, there is often limitless room for ambiguities and misunderstandings when dealing with servers. You are trying to do tasks that should be simple in theory, but you end up wasting hours and even days trying to make it work. This course helps you avoid that by taking the guesswork out of setting up your web servers on cloud providers, configuring them and scaling them.


This course provides a broad overview of the entire process of building and scaling web servers using a VPS/Cloud provider, while also providing minute step-by-step instructions (with lots of and command line examples) on performing each and every important task necessary to get your server(s) going.


Note that this course does not teach you programming or website design. It teaches you how to create, manage and scale web servers, and it even shows you how to create a working WordPress installation that you can edit and publish stuff on. It is assumed that you’d use a web developer’s services to customize your websites, or that you are a web developer yourself.
target_audience: This course is the course I wish I took when I started managing my own web servers for the businesses I own. Due to the complexity of the technologies involved, there is often limitless room for ambiguities and misunderstandings when dealing with servers.

O treinamento oferecerá toda uma base de conhecimento, desde a instalação do sistema operacional, até configurações de rede, gerenciamento de processos, administração de pacotes, domínio do editor de texto "VIM", gerenciamento de permissões, domínio do agendador de tarefas "CRON", administração remota via "SSH".
No treinamento serão apresentados conceitos básico sobre DHCP, suas características e funcionamento. Esses conhecimentos fornecidos no treinamento são a base para que você possa gerenciar outros serviços executando na plataforma Linux como: Correio; Backup, DNS, DHCP, HTTP entre outros, ou se você pretende desenvolver seus conhecimento em outras áreas como Pentest e DevOps por exemplo.

VirtualBoxの最新バージョン7だと別途、Microsoft C++ 2019をインストールが必要のようです。
自力解決が難しい場合にはVirtualBoxのバージョン6.1などをインストールされるとよいと思います。

「WindowsServer2019 評価版と検索→オンプレミスのWindowsServer2019→日本語 ISOダウンロード64ビットエディション」をインストールください
【セクション1-4】
「Windows 10 評価版と検索→Windows 10 Enterprise | Microsoft Evaluation Center→日本語 ISO – Enterprise ダウンロード 64 ビット エディション」をインストールください


※2022/5/16追記
＜注意＞
誠に申し訳ございませんが、5/6くらいから本コースで利用が必要なWindows Server2019の評価版のインストール先のマイクロソフトのWebページからWindows Server2019などがインストールできない状況となっております。
そのため、セクション1-4、1-5については初回メッセージでお送りしているURLもしくは、Q＆A「無料試用版ダウンロードクリック後、動画の画面が出てこない」に記載のURLよりWindwosServer2019「ja-jp: ISO」、Windwos10 Enterprisej a-jp: x64をインストールいただけますと幸いです。




このコースは、大きく分けて次の3部構成になっています。

書籍で学ぶ場合、理解が難しいのがActiveDirectoryです。

courses.description:
Welcome to the world of social network! In this course you will learn how to install phpFox to your websites. In this course, we will focus on installing software on your website We do not deep dive to phpFox features and functions in this course, that will be the the topic of the next course :)
Whether you want to build a social website for your business, organization, startup or just your common interest group, phpFox can help with lots of its built-in features. phpFox is a powerful social network platform for niche communities. It is fast, mobile ready and customizable and trusted by 15,000+ online communities worldwide.


phpFox Features
Easy to install
phpFox is quite easy to install, when you know what you are doing. In this course you will learn how to install the software to your website.
Social Network
Start your own social network website is never such easy with phpFox – probably the best social network software in the world. You can quickly create a social networking site with lots of built-in social features such as Friends, Feeds, User Profiles, Facebook Login, and much more. phpFox provides a lot of social network
Engagement
Your website will come alive with all of the great features we have, from Likes and Shares, to Pokes and E-Gifts. phpFox got it jam-packed with features to keep your users engaged with your site and interacting and give the ability for your users to engage other users on the site. They can manage their friends’ privacy from their “Privacy Settings” page and remove them at any time.
Monetization
Monetizing a social network doesn’t have to be hard, and phpFox make sure you have the right tools to get things started. Subscriptions, user ads, sponsorships and more! Fully integrated with Paypal payment gateway. Fully extendable by the payment gateway API should you need to add more gateways.
Localization
Your social network can become an international community once it grows. phpFox script is well-equipped for that with Multilingual, Right-to-Left, Currency and 3rd Party Translations.
Gamification
Gamification has much effect on motivating your users to take actions immediately. It encourages your users to contribute more and offer a good effect for community engagement. The gamification features include Activity Points, eGift and Promotions.
Administration
You have full control over your site with over 340 settings to choose from. You don’t need to have a much technical experience to use phpFox script. Most of them already have explanation and tutorials available. Admin Control Panel gives site admins full control of their social network from the content that is added to the activity of what is going on behind the scenes.
Extensibility
phpFox product is built on a platform with hooks placed throughout the entire script allowing you to extend the product directly from the Admin Control Panel, or 3rd party developers to extend the script functionalities via apps, themes, customization, etc.


A separate course in which I teach the function above (Engagement, Monetization, Localization, Gamification, Administration & Extensibility) is coming as soon as possible. Stay tuned for new courses and join this course now!
target_audience: You are interested to purchase phpFox, you own the licence already but need help for installing the software to your server

courses.title: Linux & Networking: Real-World Scenarios - Practice Tests
courses.bio: Test your Linux networking knowledge: 160 questions on configuration, security, troubleshooting and protocols
courses.description:
Networking is a critical skill for any Linux administrator, security expert, or DevOps professional. This course provides comprehensive practice tests covering real-world Linux networking scenarios, from configuring interfaces to securing firewalls and troubleshooting network issues.
You’ll gain hands-on experience with network configuration, security policies, performance monitoring, and essential network services, all designed to reflect real-world Linux networking challenges. These practice tests are not just theoretical—they are structured to simulate real-life scenarios, ensuring that you can apply your knowledge in practical environments.
Whether you're an aspiring system administrator, network engineer, DevOps professional, or cybersecurity specialist, these tests will help you assess your current skill level, identify gaps in your knowledge, and reinforce critical networking concepts. By working through these challenges, you’ll build the confidence to tackle real troubleshooting issues, optimize network performance, and secure Linux environments effectively.
Additionally, this course serves as valuable preparation for industry-recognized Linux networking certifications such as:
CompTIA Linux+ (XK0-005)
LPIC-2: Linux Engineer (Exam 202 & 201)
Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)
Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE)
By practicing with these tests, you’ll strengthen your problem-solving abilities, improve your efficiency in handling Linux networking tasks, and be better prepared for certification exams and real-world job roles. Whether you’re looking to pass an exam or simply validate your expertise, this course will push your knowledge to the next level.
target_audience: Linux system administrators
Network engineers
Security professionals
DevOps engineers

A Computer With at Least 16 GB Of RAM.
Anyone that want to put at least 18 Hours of their Life to learn,  enhance and sharpen there Network Skills
courses.description:
About This Class ( My Entire Course is 100% HANDS ON)


Do You want to get the real world experience of Active Directory Including DNS and DHCP on Windows Server 2019/2022  than this course is for you. I Don't do any PowerPoint slides instead the entire course is just Labs (Hands On Experience) as if you were working in a real environment. I also Included Subnetting were you will be subnetting in your head without calc or notes.


Why This Class


This Short Course Will be the same as You worked as a Network Administrator For a Company For at least 2 Years that You can put on your resume because you will actually see every section in action with labs only as you did it in a real environment. (Boot Camp Class Half Day) . If you do the 18 Hour Lab that is in this class i can assure you it will be equivalent to a 2 year experience in the Field.


What Will You Gain From This Class


This course will enhance your skills in better understating by actually doing it as we were in the same classroom utilizing AD Users and Computers, AD Domains and Trusts , AD Sites and Services and of course don't forget the DHCP and not excluding the backbone which is DNS.


In This Course you will not just learn you will actually do it yourself as if you were in an actual company doing the following:


1) How to Setup DNS Prior of install the 1st DC (In Terms of Creating the proper zone for the domain)
2) How to setup AD on the 1st Server and than the setup of AD as a replica on the 2nd Server for fault Tolerance.
3) How to create/delete/disable user accounts including reset /change passwords
4) How to create roaming profiles including home directories for users
5) How to create/delete and manage groups and understand the difference between the group types and the scopes.
6) How to Join Client PCs to the domain (First Domain which is called the parent domain and also called the Forest)
7) How to create and OU and the purpose of it
8) Installing/Configuring/Managing a DHCP Server in terms of creating scopes/reservations/filtering/leases/fault tolerance and performance and don't forget how to manage a DHCP Server from a Client PC.
9) How to establish a trust between two separate forests.
10) How To Manage Replication Through AD Sites And Services
11) How to backup and restore AD using Windows Server Backup and the AD Recycle Bin using the AD Administrative Center.
12) How to delegate control to junior admins for specific task in AD Such as reset passwords or create /delete and manage user and groups objects using a Client OS.
13) What are the FSMO Roles and the purpose of each Role
14) TCP/IP Subnetting
15) What are Forward and Reverse lookup Zones including all resource records such as A,PTR,CNAME,SRV,SOA,MX and others.
16) Install Windows 10/11 and Windows Server 2019/2022 Using VMware/VirtualBox/Hyper-V.
17) TCP/IP Classful and Classless Networks (Subnetting)
18) How To Create Forward/Reverse Lookup Zones and Their Importance.
19) What Is A Primary/Secondary/Stub/AD Zones and in What Cases You Would Use Ether One.
20) What Are All Resource Records such as A,PTR,SOA,MX,CNAME,SRV.
21) How to analyze DNS using Wireshark And What's is The Hosts File


Who is This Class For
Anybody that wants to put time and effort to learn real actual AD/DNS/DHCP Skills to reflect in the IT Field. This Class will make your life much easier than what you think you know. We always learn new skills every single day in the IT Field.
Do you want to become a Real Network Administrator (Not Just on Paper) than This class is for you.


Facts About The Course


Do I need any Work experience?
If You or Don't Work In The IT Field You Should Be Fine Taking This Course.


I Already Work In The IT Field Will I Benefit From This Course?
Working In The IT Field Doesn't Mean You Will Cover All Concepts Of Networking.


Will I get a certificate of completion at the end?
Yes You Will.

courses.description:
La nube ofrece a las organizaciones de TI oportunidades de prosperar bajo un nuevo modelo que ofrece un tiempo más rápido para valorar e innovar. Muchas organizaciones, sin embargo, se enfrentan a estrictos requisitos de cumplimiento o negocio. Para las organizaciones que lo necesitan todo: seguridad, eficiencia e innovación, Windows Server lo entrega. Windows Server es el sistema operativo listo para la nube que admite sus cargas de trabajo actuales al mismo tiempo que introduce nuevas tecnologías que facilitan la transición a la computación en la nube cuando esté listo.
Es por esto que como administradores de sistemas o futuros debemos estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología, en este curso aprenderás desde cero TODA la implementación y administración de Windows Server contenido que aplica para sus versiones 2016, 2019 y 2022.
Aprende a:
Identificar licenciamiento, edición y tipo de instalación que mas conviene a una infraestructura
Implementa los principales roles y características
Conoce toda la administración de Active Directory Domain Services, el principal rol de Windows Server
Realiza la configuración de servicios de red como DNS, DHCP
Despliega políticas de grupo GPO
Implementa servicios de Escritorio remoto
Y mucho mas...
No puedes quedarte en versiones anteriores, Windows Server incorpora muchas nuevas funcionalidades que hacen la vida diario de un administrador mucho mas sencilla y productiva al igual que ayuda a minimizar costes a las empresas y aumentar su producción.
target_audience: Administradores de sistemas

requirements: Basic understanding of computer networks and networking terminology is helpful but not required.
A willingness to learn and practice subnetting techniques.
courses.description:
Course Description:
Welcome to "Introduction to IP Addressing and Subnetting," your ultimate guide to mastering the fundamentals of IP addressing and subnetting. Whether you're a beginner just starting out or an IT professional looking to enhance your skills, this course offers a comprehensive understanding of these crucial networking concepts.
What You Will Learn:
Understanding IP Addresses:
What IP addresses are and why they are essential in networking.
The structure and components of an IP address.
IP address classes and their specific ranges.
Subnetting Fundamentals:
The purpose and importance of subnetting in network design.
How to calculate subnet masks and determine subnet IP ranges.
An introduction to CIDR (Classless Inter-Domain Routing) notation.
Strategies for efficient IP address allocation and subnet design.
Practical Subnetting Techniques:
Step-by-step methods for subnetting a network.
How to calculate the number of subnets and hosts per subnet.
Hands-on practice with subnetting examples and exercises.


Course Features:
Interactive Video Lectures: Engaging and easy-to-follow video lectures that break down complex concepts into simple, understandable segments.
Hands-on Exercises: Practical exercises and real-world examples to reinforce your learning and build your confidence in subnetting.
Lifetime Access: Enroll once and get lifetime access to the course content.
Who Should Enroll:
Networking Beginners: Individuals new to networking who want a solid foundation in IP addressing and subnetting.
IT Professionals: Current IT professionals looking to enhance their networking skills and knowledge.
Students: Networking and computer science students seeking to understand essential networking concepts.
Certification Candidates: Individuals preparing for networking certifications such as CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, and others.
Prerequisites:
Basic understanding of computer networks and networking terminology is helpful but not required.
A willingness to learn and practice subnetting techniques.
Enroll Today:
Unlock the world of IP addressing and subnetting with our comprehensive course. Gain the knowledge and skills you need to excel in networking and advance your career. Click the enroll button to get started!
target_audience: Networking Beginners: Individuals new to networking who want a solid foundation in IP addressing and subnetting.

courses.title: Linux Kernel Debugging And Instrumentation - Part 1
courses.bio: Linux Tracing with Ftrace: A deep-dive hands-on with examples
objectives: Learn how to use the tracing functionality of Linux kernel using the Ftrace subsystem
Learn about different tracers available on your Linux environment
Learn how to use function tracer, mmiotracer, function graph tracer, osnoise and hwlat tracers
Learn how to use event tracer to trace various subsystem events
Learn how to analyze performance bottle-necks, call graph and stack traces of trace output

Function Tracers: Understanding the flag-bits of the function trace output
Configuring trace_options of a function tracer
The Function Graph Tracer: Understanding configuration options of a function_graph tracer
Understanding the output of a function_graph tracer
Analyze Performance bottlenecks using function_graph tracer
Tracing code-path of network stack using function_graph tracer
Tracing NAPI poll functions using function_graph tracer
Using the osnoise and hwlat tracers
Event Tracing: Analyzing user-space addresses from event tracer output
Managing events using the set_event interface
Instrumenting kernel memory management events using event tracer
A high-level documentation walk-through of the event tracer
Using triggers in event tracing: Analyzing network traffic using histogram triggers
Analyzing scheduler events using event triggers

requirements: Good understanding of Linux kernel internals and development
Working knowledge of Linux shell and the command-line interface
Basic knowledge of scripting using bash and python
courses.description:
Unlock the power of Linux Kernel Debugging and Instrumentation with this hands-on, in-depth training course designed for developers, system administrators, and Linux enthusiasts. In Linux Kernel Debugging and Instrumentation - Part 1: Using Linux Tracing Support, you’ll dive into the robust tracing capabilities of the Linux kernel, leveraging the powerful `/sys/kernel/tracing` framework to diagnose, analyze, and optimize system performance.
This course provides a practical, step-by-step guide to mastering Linux tracing tools, including function tracing, mmiotrace, function graph tracing, and event tracing. Through live demonstrations and real-world examples, you’ll learn how to trace kernel functions, monitor hardware interactions, and analyze system behavior with precision. Whether you’re debugging complex kernel issues, optimizing performance, or simply exploring the inner workings of the Linux kernel, this course equips you with the skills to confidently use Linux tracing support.


In this course, we will explore by practical examples - tracing the network stack, Layer 2 ethernet drivers (NAPI), kernel memory management events (kmalloc / kfree events), scheduler events and syscall events. You will be able to apply the concepts learned for a wide variety of other kernel subsystems suited to your requirements.


Based on the overall reception of this course, I will release further courses in this series that cover perf-events, bpftrace, Linux Kernel Crash Dump Analysis and more...


What You’ll Learn:
Understand the fundamentals of Linux kernel tracing and its role in debugging and instrumentation.
Explore the `/sys/kernel/tracing` interface and its capabilities.
Master function tracing to monitor kernel function calls in real-time.
Use mmiotrace to trace memory-mapped I/O operations for hardware debugging.
Dive into function_graph tracing to visualize call graphs, execution flow and identify performance bottlenecks.
Leverage event tracing to monitor kernel events and system activity.
Apply these tools to solve real-world debugging challenges.


Who Is This Course For?
This course is ideal for intermediate to advanced Linux users, kernel developers, and system administrators who want to deepen their understanding of kernel debugging and instrumentation. Basic knowledge of Linux systems and C programming is recommended.
By the end of this course, you’ll have the skills and confidence to harness Linux tracing tools effectively, enabling you to diagnose and resolve complex kernel issues with ease. Enroll now and take the first step toward mastering Linux kernel debugging!
target_audience: Linux Kernel Developers
Linux Systems Engineers
Linux Enthusiasts
Linux Administrators

requirements: Sin conocimientos previos.
courses.description:
Buenas a todos!!!


Empecé a trabajar con Mainframe cuando tenía 18 años, he decido crear este curso debido a la falta de material que hay y a la gran cantidad de conocimientos e información que se van perdiendo según pasan los años.


En este curso vamos a aprender todo lo relacionado con z/OS y cómo trabajar con el sistema. No hace falta tener conocimientos previos, ya que empezaremos desde 0, pero os aseguro que desde el principio va a ser muy interesante para todo el mundo aunque tengáis conocimientos de Mainframe, ya que vamos a ver perfeccionar los conceptos que tenemos y a entender adecuadamente lo que tenemos entre manos cuando estamos usando un Mainframe, desde qué es, de qué está compuesto y cómo trabaja.
Comprobaremos lo importante que es Mainframe y lo requerido que es hoy en día para mover el mundo en el que vivimos.


Os contaré cómo conseguir acceso de manera gratuita y legal a un Mainframe con z/OS para que podáis acceder desde vuestro ordenador. Para que si en vuestro trabajo no podéis probar lo que hacemos en el curso, lo probéis en este entorno. Os guiaré para acceder a este sistema de IBM y cómo instalar la herramienta para conectarnos al Mainframe. Y además tiene la última versión de z/OS, nada de versiones antiguas donde no tenemos todas las opciones y herramientas disponibles.


Luego veremos los componentes más importantes y cómo trabajar con ellos:
-Sysplex: Al ver los recursos y componentes de un Mainframe veremos detalladamente qué es un Sysplex y cómo se comparte la información.
-TSO: Veremos qué es y cómo ejecutar comandos.
-ISPF: Veremos esta herramienta en profundidad ya que es muy importante. Analizaremos configuraciones y las opciones más importantes, entre ellas nos meteremos de lleno con la opción 3. Utilities, donde veremos cómo crear ficheros, los comandos primarios y comandos de línea al listart y editar datasets, la opción 3.4 DSList, etc.
-SDSF: Veremos también en profundidad esta otra herramienta que se usa continuamente a diario. Analizaremos cada panel y veremos toda clase de comandos que podemos ejecutar, además también veremos los logs y cómo entender la información que nos muestran.
-JCL: Analizaremos el lenguaje clave usado en z/OS y gracias al cuál pueden correr los trabajos, usuarios y tareas.


Espero que disfrutéis y este curso os sirva de ayuda.
Estaré disponible y contesto rápido a los emails, podéis contactar conmigo ante cualquier necesidad.


Muchas gracias!
Un saludo!!!

courses.title: Linux Shell Scripting Practice Tests
courses.bio: A Comprehensive Journey from Basics to Professional-Level Automation and System Administration
courses.description:
Practice Test 1: Shell Basics
1. Basic Commands and Navigation
o Strategy: Start by learning essential commands like ls, cd, pwd, mkdir, and touch. Practice basic navigation and file manipulation.
2. File Permissions and Ownership
o Strategy: Understand the concepts of file permissions (chmod) and ownership (chown). Learn how to manage access control on files and directories.
3. Pipes and Redirection
o Strategy: Explore the use of pipes (|) and redirection (>, >>, <) to manipulate input and output streams. Practice combining commands with these techniques.
Practice Test 2: Shell Scripting Fundamentals
1. Variables and Data Types
o Strategy: Learn how to declare and use variables in shell scripts. Understand different data types, such as strings and numbers.
2. Conditional Statements
o Strategy: Master if, elif, and else statements for creating conditional logic in scripts. Practice using comparisons and logical operators.
3. Loops (for, while)
o Strategy: Explore for and while loops for repetitive tasks. Understand loop control structures and iterate through data or directories.
Practice Test 3: Functions and Script Organization
1. Creating Functions
o Strategy: Learn how to define and call functions in shell scripts. Organize your code for reusability and modularity.
2. Command Line Arguments
o Strategy: Understand how to pass and process command-line arguments. Create scripts that take input from users or external sources.
3. Script Structure and Best Practices
o Strategy: Study best practices for organizing and documenting your scripts. Create scripts that are easy to maintain and share with others.
Practice Test 4: Advanced Scripting
1. Arrays and Data Structures
o Strategy: Explore arrays and other data structures to store and manipulate collections of data. Use them in practical scenarios.
2. File Handling
o Strategy: Learn how to read, write, and manipulate files in shell scripts. Handle file I/O effectively.
3. Regular Expressions (Regex)
o Strategy: Understand regular expressions and how to use them for pattern matching and text processing in scripts.
Practice Test 5: Scripting for System Administration
1. Process Management
o Strategy: Explore commands and scripting techniques for managing processes, such as ps, kill, and top.
2. System Monitoring and Logging
o Strategy: Learn how to monitor system resources and work with system logs using shell scripts.
3. Automating System Tasks
o Strategy: Create scripts to automate repetitive system administration tasks, like backups, user management, and maintenance.
Practice Test 6: Scripting in a Professional Environment
1. Error Handling and Debugging
o Strategy: Develop skills for error handling, troubleshooting, and debugging shell scripts. Learn to handle unexpected situations gracefully.
2. Security and Permissions
o Strategy: Understand security implications and best practices when writing scripts that interact with sensitive data or system settings.
3. Integration with Other Tools
o Strategy: Explore how to integrate shell scripts with other tools and languages, such as Python, for more advanced automation and data processing.
target_audience: Aspiring Developers
System Administrators
Data Professionals
DevOps Practitioners
Anyone Pursuing Automation

courses.title: Docker everything you need to know in under an hour
courses.bio: An in-depth course going through the basics concepts of Docker in under 60 minutes.
requirements: A computer with access to a Linux terminal. (Fear not! Virtual Machine setup is included in this for users who don't have a Linux terminal available. )
That's it! With a good work ethic, let's get started and learn some Docker!
courses.description:
Welcome to the Docker everything you need to know in under an hour! This course aims to teach you the fundamentals of Docker and apply them in the working environment.. We also aim to show the more complex features of functions of Docker to really get the student ready for the working world.
The course teaches the following:
Docker
Docker Run
DockerFiles
Docker and PHP
Docker with NGINX
Docker Exex
Docker Tags
Docker Volumes
Docker Inspect
Docker Logs
Installing VMs
Installing Ubuntu
Installing VS Code
Installing Packages
And much more!
The in-depth course aims to get the the student up and running, straight to the point and teach them how to going with Docker.
By far, the most widely used containerisation system in the world today is Docker. And in this course we aim to get you up and running! Docker is a set of platform as a service  products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels. Because all of the containers share the services of a single operating system kernel, they use fewer resources than virtual machines.
By going through each of the Docker commands we are trying to enable you to pick up Docker in a relatively short amount of time.
We hope you enjoy it!
target_audience: DevOps Professionals
DevOps Engineers
DevOps
Coders
Docker
Software
Linux

requirements: Conocer el entorno Mainframe de IBM

courses.description:
¿Sabías que gran parte de las Transacciones Financieras a nivel mundial utilizan CICS?
Gracias a este software de IBM, las principales compañías del mundo procesan diariamente millones de transacciones en línea para sus Clientes.
¿Deseas conocer cómo programar con CICS utilizando el Lenguaje de Programación COBOL?


¡¡Bienvenido al Curso: “Programando en COBOL-CICS”!!


En este Curso aprenderás, paso a paso, como utilizar Comandos CICS en un Programa COBOL.
Aquí los principales temas:
¿Qué es CICS? Plataformas y Lenguajes
Cómo incrustar Comandos de CICS en COBOL
Pasos para compilar programas COBOL que usan Comandos de CICS y Sentencias de SQL
Diferencias entre Programación Conversacional y Programación Pseudo-Conversacional
Transacciones para operar en CICS: CESN, CECI, CEMT, CEDF, CESF y CEDA
Desarrollo, codificación, compilación y ejecución de Mapas en entorno Mainframe usando Basic Mapping Support (BMS)
Desarrollo, codificación, compilación y ejecución de programas COBOL-CICS en entorno Mainframe TSO-ISPF
Uso de SPUFI para generar Declarativas de SQL
Uso de Mapas y Programas COBOL-CICS para:
Consulta de información en archivos VSAM y Tablas de DB2
Actualización de archivos VSAM
Consultas para paginar información
Te recomiendo que respetes la secuencia que tiene este Programa del Curso y de esta forma lo aproveches al máximo.


¿Por qué estoy compartiendo este Curso contigo?
Los especialistas actuales que conocen los Mainframes y el COBOL utilizando CICS, tienen entre 50 y 65 años, por lo que están a punto de jubilarse. Ahora los jóvenes profesionales tendrán que dar continuidad al trabajo que venían desempeñando todos aquellos especialistas de Mainframe COBOL-CICS, sin embargo, la generación más joven tiende a tener poca o ninguna experiencia con los equipos Mainframe ya que se han centrado más en la información distribuida, la Web y las tecnologías móviles.
Existe un alto riesgo de tener una pérdida de capital intelectual y llegar a tener una falta de personal con experiencia en el manejo de esta tecnología que aún muchas empresas utilizan.
Deseo que este Curso sea de gran utilidad para aquellos jóvenes profesionales que están conscientes del gran mercado que aún existe en el uso de los Mainframes con programas COBOL-CICS y que con su talento contribuyan al crecimiento de las áreas de TI de las grandes organizaciones.
target_audience: Programadores COBOL
Soporte Técnico a Mainframes IBM

courses.title: Write first assembly language program and run it on emulator
courses.bio: We will learn how to translate an assembly source file to an executable file, and run it on the emulator Bochs.

Introduction: What you will learn in this course
Write our first assembly program and tra: Write our very first program in assembly language
Write your very first assembly program
GNU assembler, Linux Desktop, virtual machine & hypervisor
Install Ubuntu Desktop if no any other Linux distribution is available for you
Terminal, basic Linux commands and Binutils
Try the most commonly used Linux commands, and make sure GNU as is available
Copy this into your first.s file, if you do not want to write the code yourself
Assembly, object file, binary, hexadecimal, disassembly, architecture and i8086
Link the object file and run it on Bochs: Linking, executable file or runnable, booting, POST, ROM, legacy BIOS, MBR & RAM
Run our first program using Bochs
Explain our first assembly language program line by line
Make a script file to save clicks
Run your program and make a sript file for it

requirements: No. Even friendly to high school (middle school) students.
courses.description:
In this short course, we will firstly introduce what is assembly language and machine language, the correspondence between them. Then we write our very first program in assembly language.
In order to run this program, we need a program called assembler to translate our assembly program to an object file, and then use another program called linker to transfer this object file to the executable file. We are going to do all of these on a Linux Distribution Ubuntu Desktop.
I will show you how to do all of these step by step. From installing the Linux Desktop, the most commonly used Linux commands, to the use of GNU assembler, GNU linker and objdump. And how to make a script file.
We also cover a bunch of concepts: hexadecimal, disassembly, instruction set architecture, booting, Power on Self Test, read only memory, legacy BIOS, master booting block, random access memory, interrupt and ASCII character etc..
We will see how to do the compilation of the source code of the Bochs and the installation, using the classical steps: configure, make, and make install. Eventually we will run our first program on Bochs.
I guarantee you will learn the basic usage of lots of Linux commands and programs, understand better over the low-level computer technical concepts. From there we have the ability to explore more over the computer operating system. See you.
target_audience: University students or who are interested in low level principles of computer science

requirements: ・AWS（アマゾン・ウェブ・サービス）でアカウントを作る際に、クレジットカードが必要になります
・上記の条件ですが、アカウントを作っても、何もしなければ課金はありません
・Windowsを使って説明するので、できたらWindows使用の方（Macでもできますが、各自、読み替えが必要）
courses.description:
AWSを勉強の道具とみなして、アカウント作成する
AWSとは、アマゾン ウェブ サービスの略です。
個人でLinuxサーバを構築するのは面倒ですが、
AWSを使うと、Linuxサーバをボタン一発で構築できます。
ただし、Linuxサーバを構築したまま放置すると、課金され続けてしまう（汗）。
しかし、勉強する時だけ構築する使い方なら、1回100円以下というレベルで済む。
まずは、この使い方を理解し、アカウントを作成し、
勉強する準備をしましょう。




EC2を作成する
EC2は、Elastic Compute Cloudの略で、
要するに、AWSで作成できるサーバです。
もちろん、Linuxサーバも作成できます。
まずは、EC2を作成しましょう。




●Linuxサーバ作成後、コマンド操作を学ぶ
WindowsやMacは、GUI（グラフィカル ユーザー インターフェース）で操作しますね。
しかし、Linuxはコマンド操作します。
（多くの人は、ここで躓く）


以下のコマンド操作を学びましょう。


ディレクトリ（フォルダ）操作
Linuxサーバも、WindowsやMacのように、
ディレクトリ（フォルダ）があります。
コマンド操作を学びましょう。


ファイル操作
Linuxサーバも、WindowsやMacのように、
ファイルがあります。
コマンド操作を学びましょう。


パーミッション（アクセス権限）の理解
Linuxサーバは、複数の人が使うことを前提としているため、
パーミッション（アクセス権限）が厳しいです。
ここで挫折する人も多いので、しっかり、理解していきましょう。


ファイル編集（viの使用方法）
Windowsでファイル編集する場合は、例えば、メモ帳を使いますね。
Linuxでは、viというソフトを使います。この使い方を学びましょう。


検索テクニック
Linuxは検索機能が強力です。
ファイルの検索、ファイル中の文字列、検索できるようにします。


シェル（Linuxプログラム）
シェルは、Linux上で動くプログラムです。
簡単なシェルを作り、動かしてみます。

courses.title: SRE Basics : A Beginner’s Guide
courses.bio: Learn SRE principles, practices, metrics and implementation that can build reliable, scalable systems in simple way.
objectives: What is Site Reliability Engineering?
How SRE Works in Practice
Role of a Site Reliability Engineer
Core SRE Metrics
What are Silos in SRE and how SRE helps in breaking it.
Understanding Core principles of SRE
Key practices of SRE
What is Blameless Postmortem and steps to implement it
Implementing Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) in an organization
requirements: Basic understanding of what Software Development is, no coding experience is required as such
Understanding of IT Operations like familiarity with operational workflows, infrastructure management and system monitoring.
courses.description:
In today's fast-paced digital world, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) has become a critical practice with organizations across industries embracing it to enhance system reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
As businesses rely on complex infrastructures, ensuring smooth and uninterrupted service has never been more important.
Reliability is at the heart of modern infrastructure and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) bridges the gap between development and operations to create highly resilient systems.


In this course, you'll explore the core principles of SRE, including automation, monitoring, incident management and error budgeting.
You’ll learn how to define Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and foster a culture of collaboration between engineering teams. With examples this course equips you with the skills needed to implement SRE practices effectively.

Below are key topics which will be covered as a part of this course -
What is Site Reliability Engineering?
How SRE Works in Practice
Role of a Site Reliability Engineer
Deep Dive into Core SRE Metrics
What are Silos in SRE?
How SRE Helps Break Silos
Understanding Core principles of SRE
Key practices of SRE
What is Blameless Postmortem and steps to implement it
Implementing Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) in an organization


Whether you're a developer, operations engineer or tech enthusiast, this course will empower you to build scalable, high-performing systems while balancing innovation and reliability.
target_audience: A Beginner who is unaware about SRE
This course is designed for one who is eager to understand Site Reliability Engineering principles, practices and their real-world applications.

2 - Muovere i primi passi: 2.2 - Preparazione di Windows per l’installazione di GNU/Linux

4.8 - Gestione dei permessi su file e cartelle

9 - Risoluzione problemi: 9.6 - Riparare Arch anche quando non si avvia
9.7 - Pacman: impossibile aggiornare il sistema - unknown trust

requirements: Terminologia dell'informatica di base (Byte, Bit, Mb, ...)
courses.description:
Archlinux è una distro leggera, flessibile e moderna... Ma se sei alle prime armi con Linux probabilmente ti diranno di stare alla larga da Arch!
Bene, io non la penso così.
Benvenuto su Arch Linux Per Comuni Mortali.
Il programma del corso è pensato per imparare Linux da zero su una distribuzione fresca, stimolante e sfidante al punto giusto. In questo corso ti guiderò passo passo attraverso ogni aspetto della distribuzione: dalla sua anatomia all'installazione su PC, fino all'utilizzo come sistema operativo principale. Non poteva quindi mancare un'intera sezione dedicata alla risoluzione dei problemi che inevitabilmente incontrerai nell'uso di tutti i giorni, ma di cui raramente si parla in un corso.
Ti insegnerò teoria e pratica, con illustrazioni animate ed esempi concreti che potrai applicare alla tua installazione per ottenere il massimo dalla tua distro preferita. Al termine di questo corso sarai in grado di utilizzare qualsiasi distro a un livello base e potrai raccontare a tutti che hai inziato con Archlinux!
A differenza dei miei corsi sulle certificazioni professionali, questo corso segue un approccio naturale e discorsivo, le tematiche toccate sono più vicine all’uso desktop, concetti e nozioni sono introdotti quando servono e il livello di dettaglio è adeguato ma non soffocante. Potete immaginarla come una chiacchierata in amicizia in cui vi mostro come funziona un sistema GNU/Linux.

courses.description:
Taking a course on Proxmox with a focus on showing unattended Windows installations offers a myriad of benefits and valuable knowledge for individuals in the realm of IT infrastructure management, virtualization, and system administration. Here's why such a course is highly advantageous:
Efficiency in Deployment: Learning how to utilize Proxmox for unattended Windows installations enables efficient deployment of Windows operating systems across multiple virtual machines. This is particularly valuable in enterprise environments where deploying numerous instances of Windows is a routine task.
Time-saving Automation: The course likely covers automation techniques using Proxmox, allowing administrators to streamline the installation process. With unattended installations, repetitive tasks can be automated, saving considerable time and effort.
Enhanced Scalability: Understanding how to deploy Windows unattendedly on Proxmox facilitates scalability. Whether it's provisioning new virtual machines or expanding existing infrastructure, this knowledge ensures smooth and rapid scaling without sacrificing accuracy.
Resource Optimization: Through the course, participants can grasp techniques for resource optimization when deploying Windows on Proxmox. This includes configuring hardware resources such as CPU cores, RAM, and storage efficiently to maximize performance and minimize waste.
Improved Management and Maintenance: Managing a fleet of Windows virtual machines becomes more manageable with Proxmox. Participants will learn about centralized management tools, monitoring capabilities, and best practices for maintaining a healthy virtualized environment.
Cost-effectiveness: Utilizing Proxmox for unattended Windows installations can lead to cost savings by reducing the time and resources required for manual deployments. Additionally, Proxmox's open-source nature eliminates licensing fees associated with proprietary virtualization solutions.
Competitive Advantage: In the IT job market, proficiency in Proxmox and automated deployment techniques can provide a competitive edge. Employers seek candidates with skills that drive efficiency and productivity, making this course a valuable addition to one's skill set.
In essence, enrolling in a course focused on Proxmox with a specialization in unattended Windows installations equips individuals with the knowledge and tools needed to optimize deployment processes, enhance system management capabilities, and stay ahead in today's rapidly evolving IT landscape.
target_audience: Admins who want to learn how to use unattended windows installations on proxmox.

requirements: Aucune condition préalable, n'importe qui avec un ordinateur et de la motivation peut y participer !
courses.description:
[UPDATE 2025]
Ce cours s'adresse à un public novice qui souhaite apprendre à utiliser un système d'exploitation de type Linux, avec un focus particulier autour des distributions Ubuntu et Debian.
Profitez d'un contenu éprouvé, et donné en présentiel dans plusieurs écoles d'informatique parisiennes (ESGI, CFI, ITIC, ...), un vrai guide à suivre pour maîtriser les bases de fonctionnement d'un système Linux.
Dans ce cours vous retrouverez les éléments importants suivants :
Ensemble des vidéos sous-titrées pour joindre la lecture à l'écoute
Installation de l'environnement de tests pas à pas
Explication du fonctionnement des systèmes Linux via la ligne de commande et l'interface graphique
Réaliser l'administration basique et avancée de votre système Linux
Introduction au scripting Shell/Bash pour commencer à automatiser votre système
Plus de 12 Travaux Pratiques pour mettre en oeuvre vos nouvelles compétences !*
Chaque notion est désormais associée à un exercice en ligne gratuit qui vous permet de manipuler sans avoir besoin d'installer une machine virtuelle. En effet, grâce aux exercices que j'ai créé sur et publié sur Gitlab, vous avez accès à des énoncés corrigés complets, et à un terminal utilisant Play With Docker. Il ne reste plus qu'à dérouler.


Dans un premier temps, nous reprendrons toutes les bases nécessaires à la bonne compréhension du fonctionnement du système, et nous verrons étape par étape comment installer et paramétrer sa version d'Ubuntu 24.04 LTS grâce à Virtualbox
Dans un deuxième temps, nous explorerons notre distribution Ubuntu, en y voyant les différents dossiers racines existants, puis le shell et les commandes Linux de base. Il est important d'avoir le réflexe d'utiliser le man sur Linux et nous l'étudierons dans une vidéo dédiée.


Dans un troisième temps, les éditeurs de texte nano et vim seront abordés, tout comme la manipulation et l'interaction de l'utilisateur avec les fichiers. Nous y verrons les redirections du shell et surtout les droits d'accès, mais également comment utiliser les commandes find et locate pour effectuer des recherches sur son système.


Dans la quatrième partie, la gestion des utilisateurs et des groupes, les services SSH, et networking (avec netplan) et la gestion des processus seront abordés en détail.


Nous continuerons en cinquième partie sur le scripting bash de base, dont l'utilisation avancée est disponible dans un autre cours.


Une nouvelle sixième partie, portant sur les tâches d'administration d'un système Linux avec notamment l'explication de l'utilisation des commandes permettant de gérer les processus, processeurs, mémoire RAM SWAP et espace disque, grâce à top, ps, iostat, uptime et plein d'autres.


Enfin il existe de nombreuses vidéos bonus, comme l'installation et la configuration du serveur DNS Bind9, l'utilisation de Putty, l'installation et la configuration d'un serveur RADIUS, etc...
A la fin de ce cours, vous serez capable d'être complètement autonome dans l'utilisation de votre système Linux. Vous pourrez sans problème suivre des conversations portant sur ce domaine et vous serez capable d'être force de proposition.
target_audience: Novice en utilisation de Linux

Neste curso, o instrutor explica as técnicas para criar restrições, controles, instalação de software entre diversas padronizações essenciais no dia a dia de um administrador de redes.
O curso é ministrado utilizando uma didática extremamente simples,  descomplicada e totalmente prática.
Este curso foi feito para fornecer uma base sólida do Active Directory utilizando o Windows Server 2019, que é o mais recente sistema operacional Windows Server disponível (lançado em outubro de 2018).
Este curso é ótimo para quem procura avançar (ou começar) sua carreira em Tecnologia da Informação.

requirements: 1.5 GHz CPU or faster 64-bit processor
8 GB RAM or more
